plastic glasses knives forks and food boxes are being been banned in france bertrand combaldieu associated press paris france has apparently become the first country in the world to ban plastic plates cups and utensils passing law that will go into effect in exceptions will be allowed for items made of compostable biosourced materials the new law is part of the country energy transition for green growth act the same legislation that also outlawed plastic bags in grocery stores and markets beginning in july although plastic bags are forbidden in other countries including in some states no country seems to have embraced plastic ban as sweeping as france will be the general idea behind the law following the landmark conference held in paris last fall on curbing global warming is to promote circular economy of waste disposal from product design to recycling french lawmakers say maryland county nickel tax for plastic bags is paying off but not as planned objections to plastic as material are well known for one it does not biodegrade and only breaks down into smaller and smaller particles which pose significant danger for wildlife that cannot always distinguish it from food sources particularly in oceans aside from ecosystem disruptions millions of barrels of oil are used every year in manufacturing plastic bags and utensils playing what environmental activists call significant role in climate change in the words of french president fran ois hollande the ban is part of larger push intended to make france an exemplary nation in terms of reducing greenhouse gas emissions diversifying its energy model and increasing the deployment of renewable energy sources starting it would seem with the forks and knives distributed at fast food restaurants and the coffee cups in vending machines not all share the enthusiasm of france socialist government which has made environmental progress one of its main goals in brussels some argue that the laws violate existing european union legislation regarding the free movement of goods and the protection of manufacturers eamonn bates the secretary general of pack go europe brussels based association that represents packaging manufacturers on the continent told the associated press that his organization will challenge france ban we are urging the european commission to do the right thing and to take legal action against france for infringing european law he said if they don we will supporters of the ban wanted it to be introduced earlier possibly as soon as but gol ne royal the french environment minister had initially considered it an anti social provision on the grounds that low income families relied on plastic utensils and plates the ban was then postponed until
france becomes the first country to ban plastic plates and cutlery

donald trump has reputation in the media for being open and accessible to interview requests he is known for willingness to spout off to whoever sticks microphone in front of his face and it has helped him get this far as political candidate but lately as trump has hired new handlers and other assorted campaign personnel he has also been in something of retreat that is trump is only talking to fox news right now trump is saying yes to fox news almost every day but saying no to most other major networks and news organizations highly unusual strategy for presidential nominee he called into fox friends on monday morning he is booked on the reilly factor monday night and he has another town hall with sean hannity coming up on wednesday rousing the base instead of reaching out to undecided voters may ultimately pay off for trump if nothing else it limits the candidate exposure to hard hitting questions while fueling frustration among journalists at fox news trump can avoid pesky follow up questions about his support for the racist birther conspiracy long after he claims to have dropped it fox news hosts won ask him why he reacts to possible terrorism by screaming about how he was right rather than express condolences for the victims and support for law enforcement at fox news trump isn challenged and that the way he wants it the problem is wrapping up in the fox news cocoon may feel good for the time being but the way to win an election is to appeal to audiences outside of your base of comfort trump isn reaching out it is strategy that shows up elsewhere in his campaign where instead of following the model of successful politicians like george bush and president obama by holding campaign rallies in swing districts hoping to persuade voters trump has rallies with the converted on election day in fox news viewers were shocked to find the romney landslide the network had kept promoting was harsh reality they may be setting themselves up for major failure featured under the radar blog archives select date july june may april march february january december november october september august magistrate won order federal arraignment for bombing suspect federal magistrate has turned down request from defense lawyers that the man accused of the weekend bombings in new york and new jersey be immediately arraigned on set of federal charges he is facing manhattan based magistrate judge gabriel gorenstein agreed with federal prosecutors that suspect ahmad rahami need not have an initial federal court appearance until he is taken into federal custody and by all appearances he currently in the custody of local officials in new jersey the magistrate said the federal government explicitly denies that it has arrested the defendant there is no evidence to the contrary gorenstein wrote in two page order released wednesday evening gorenstein noted that defense lawyers said it is undisputed that federal law enforcement are involved in detaining and questioning rahami in fact this question is very much in dispute the magistrate wrote the government asserts unequivocally that the defendant is not in federal custody whether there are federal authorities questioning defendant does not address the issue of custody at this point the court has no evidence whatsoever from anyone with personal knowledge that the defendant is being detained by any federal officer the magistrate also rejected defense lawyers claims that federal court rule requires rahami be promptly arraigned on the federal charges even if he is arrested by state authorities gorenstein not only declined to schedule court appearance for rahami who at newark hospital and could have been arraigned there but said he lacks authority to appoint the court indigent defense providers at the federal defenders of new york to formally represent rahami attorney general loretta lynch said wednesday morning that rahami will be brought to new york city in the near future to face the federal complaint there which is expected to take precedence over attempted murder charges filed in county court in new jersey and another federal complaint in the garden state spokesman for attorney preet bharara office declined to comment on the decision saying the ruling could speak for itself the defense attorney who asked for the arraignment james patton did not immediately respond to request for comment on the magistrate decision josh gerstein is senior reporter for politico
magistrate won order federal arraignment for bombing suspect

the recent connected bombings in new york and new jersey and the stabbing attack at mall in minnesota have increased interest in how the presidential candidates would handle national security hillary clinton and donald trump have spoken out since the attacks which left dozens of people injured john cohen former coordinator for the department of homeland security said he believes that the terrorist attacks that have occurred during the campaign have significant impact on voters when events occur like this you tend to have people become more fearful and when people are more fearful they tend to gravitate towards candidate who appears to be more strong said cohen who currently works as an abc news consultant three of the latest national polls all conducted before the attacks this weekend had clinton leading when respondents were asked whom they trust to handle the issue of terrorism in an abc news washington post poll released sept clinton led percent to trump percent among all adults and percent to trump percent among likely voters when asked about who was more trusted to handle terrorism cbs new york times poll released sept had clinton doing better job handling terrorism and national security according to percent of respondents compared with trump percent the split was closest in quinnipiac poll released sept in which respondents were asked who they thought would do better job keeping the country safe from terrorism regardless of how you intend to vote in that poll clinton got percent to trump percent traditionally it been the republican party who has projected strength and awareness in the area of law enforcement and homeland security but today that kind of flipped because despite his rhetoric there are number of national security experts who have raised concerns about the level of understanding that donald trump has as it relates to terrorism and national security threats cohen said andres kudacki ap photo current events are factoring into the political campaigns with the candidates scheduling speeches about national security in the wake of attacks but cohen said political rhetoric could also be affecting and even motivating the attacks themselves he said trump rhetoric and calls to bar foreign muslims from entering the united states may even serve to further along those who are becoming inspired to act on isis behalf james campbell professor of political science at the university at buffalo in new york who has written book about political polarization told abc news that he believes the attacks translate to potential advantage for trump have to think that terrorist events in this country help trump and hurt clinton for these events to be occurring with the frequency they do may be read by many as failure of the current administration and particularly its foreign policy team to effectively deal with the problem he said it may also suggest that we need tougher approach to dealing with terrorism an approach associated with trump when suspects are identified who have muslim sounding names then that may further fuel support for tougher immigration standards and scrutiny campbell added

election presidential debate the first general election presidential debate of will be held at hofstra university in hempstead new york on sept story continued below what time is the debate and how long is it the debate will start at eastern time and run for minutes without commercial breaks how can watch the debate it will be broadcast on all of the major television networks as well as the websites for major cable news channels and span who will participate in the debate former secretary of state hillary clinton and celebrity real estate mogul donald trump no other candidates qualified who will moderate the debate lester holt who anchors nbc nightly news will be the moderator it his second time serving in that role in the presidential cycle holt was also moderator for the democratic primary debate on january on february holt became the substitute anchor of nbc nightly news after brian williams was suspended four months later he became the permanent anchor what is the format of the debate the debate will be divided into six segments of minutes each each segment will start with question from holt after which each candidates will have two minutes for an initial response and then will be allowed to respond to each other on monday the commission on presidential debates announced the tentative topics for the debate america direction achieving prosperity and securing america the topics are subject to change based on news developments according to the commission why aren jill stein or gary johnson participating in the debate libertarian party presidential nominee gary johnson and green party presidential nominee jill stein were not invited by the presidential debate commission the commission said it would only invite candidates that averaged percent in five national polls it selected neither johnson nor stein made that threshold what at stake for hillary clinton the debate is clinton chance to turn the page on few weeks during which trump has eaten much of the polling lead she built following her convention clinton camp has also been counting on her policy knowledge and debate experience to help her expose trump weaknesses but the democratic candidate also comes in facing higher expectations than trump what at stake for donald trump trump has been accused lacking policy gravitas and self restraint and both of those perceived weaknesses could be exposed in debate where candidates will be grilled on their familiarity with issues foreign and domestic and be expected to keep composed under rhetorical assault from their opponents trump has the advantage however of low expectations at several turns in the presidential campaign even modest pivots away from his bombastic primary style were hailed as pivots to professionalism and similar self restraint provided he still hits the high notes his supporters are expected could help him clear the low bar again what is the most watched debate in presidential history in the debate between president jimmy carter and republican presidential nominee ronald reagan garnered viewership of million people the largest television audience for debate since nielsen ratings began collecting viewership data in in the first general election presidential debate between president barack obama and republican presidential nominee mitt romney attracted about million viewers what the most watched television moment of all time super bowl xlix in on nbc is currently the most watched television program in history attracting million viewers according to nbc news the new england patriots played against the seattle seahawks winning the game still that pales in comparison to the estimated million people worldwide who watched neil armstrong and buzz aldrin make the first moon landing on under the radar blog archives select date july june may april march february january december november october september august ahmad khan rahami is taken into custody after shootout with police monday in linden nicolaus czarnecki boston herald via ap attorney sees no rush to arraign rahami in federal court federal prosecutors are pushing back against demand by defense lawyers that new york and new jersey bombing suspect ahmad rahami be arraigned immediately on federal charges he is facing late tuesday defense attorneys wrote to federal magistrate judge gabriel gorenstein asking that rahami be promptly informed of the charges against him at court proceeding that would also formally advise him of his right to counsel and his right to remain silent however prosecutors from the office of attorney for the southern district of new york preet bharara said in letter to the magistrate wednesday that rahami isn in federal custody so there is no legal obligation for the federal courts to get involved the defendant in this case ahmad khan rahami ahmad rahimi has not been arrested on any federal charge he is not in federal custody he is in the custody of the state of new jersey on state charges and is subject to bail package issued by the new jersey state court federal prosecutors wrote while writ of habeas corpus ad prosequendum has been lodged with the united states marshals service it has not been executed and there has been no such federal arrest the writ referred to in the federal prosecutors letter would require state or local officials to hand over rahami to federal authorities for prosecution rahami is facing five attempted murder charges in new jersey court in connection with shootout monday morning in which the suspect and two police officers were wounded rahami is currently in newark hospital judge has set million bail and an initial county court appearance for sept defense lawyers contend that rahami has been without the benefit of counsel since his arrest but it unclear whether he been advised of his miranda rights or whether he made some decision not to meet with an attorney lawmakers briefed on the investigation say he has not been cooperating while attorney general loretta lynch said wednesday that rahami would be taken to manhattan in the near future the letter from prosecutors evinces no urgency to such move prosecutors say rahami has no rights in the federal system at the moment including right to counsel the letter indicates that lawyers from the federal defenders office in new york have sought appointment in rahami case but prosecutors say that plainly premature until he is brought to court prosecutors cited series of terrorism cases where judges ruled defendants were not entitled to court appointed counsel until they appear in court court records show no immediate action from gorenstein on the request for rahami arraignment or the defense lawyers request to be appointed as his counsel in the case josh gerstein is senior reporter for politico authors

newark cnn former port authority executives and new jersey gov chris christie staffers planned to make the traffic from the september lane closures at the george washington bridge as bad as possible according to testimony heard in federal court monday david wildstein former port authority director of interstate capital projects testified that in june bridget kelly christie former deputy chief of staff was upset that their office had not secured the endorsement of the democratic mayor of fort lee new jersey mark sokolich for christie reelection campaign wildstein who has previously pleaded guilty to one charge of conspiracy to commit fraud on federally funded property and one civil rights violation told kelly that shutting down access lanes to the george washington bridge to put some political pressure on sokolich was an option according to his testimony wildstein is testifying as part of his plea deal sokolich testified last week that being democrat in democratic town put him in an uncomfortable position vis vis christie endorsement and he eventually declined because he did not want to alienate anyone on august and as cnn has previously reported wildstein received an email from kelly saying time for some traffic problems in fort lee got it wildstein responded phone call with kelly the same day established the lane closures would go forward it was revealed in testimony monday did not question senior officials in the office of the governor wildstein said in court when asked if he questioned the decision wildstein became the de facto organizer of the eventual lane closures and communicated every step of the way with kelly and his then boss former port authority deputy executive director bill baroni according to his testimony wildstein and kelly discussed and agreed that there would be no advance notice of the closures to fort lee officials or the public they discussed how the port authority would respond to any inquiries and agreed that all calls would be directed to baroni office and baroni would not return the calls testimony revealed this radio silence policy was discussed with and approved by baroni wildstein said wildstein testified that that lack of advance notice was to maximize the impact on fort lee wildstein also recalled discussing the timing of the closures with baroni and kelly baroni asked when the first day of school in fort lee was and when wildstein told baroni it was september baroni smiled and said fantastic according to wildstein testimony kelly agreed on the september date wildstein testified that his initial plan was to shut down all three fort lee access lanes but after discussing the matter with port authority engineers who feared this could cause sideswipe crashes wildstein recommended to baroni and kelly that they shut down two lanes on friday september wildstein informed several port authority staffers of the closures that were scheduled to begin on monday september bob durando port authority general manager of the george washington bridge expressed concern telling wildstein that the closures would cause mess wildstein told durando the closures would be going forward and to prepare accordingly told him not to say anything to anybody wildstein testified wildstein told durando to direct any inquiries he gets during the closures to baroni office wildstein then informed former port authority chief engineer peter zipf of the closures and asked zipf to organize way to get some numbers on the traffic patterns wildstein also informed cedrick fulton port authority director of tunnels bridges and terminals fulton asked if port authority executive director patrick foye was aware wildstein testified that he told fulton yes but that this was lie all of these staffers were under the impression that the closures were part of traffic study on the day the closures began wildstein watched the traffic build up on screens inside port authority administration building on the fort lee side of the george washington bridge knew the plan that had set into motion was working wildstein testified port authority lieutenant also drove wildstein around fort lee so wildstein could see the traffic on the ground wildstein testified that he called kelly that morning to tell her that traffic was building up and she was pleased several calls and emails began coming in to baroni and wildstein from fort lee officials including the mayor sokolich but their plan of radio silence was put into effect and no messages were returned last week wildstein testified that baroni role at the bi state agency was essentially to be representative of christie administration and that their top priority was to represent christie office interests wildstein said he created phrase that he and baroni often used the one constituent rule this referred to the fact that governor christie opinion or good favor was the only one that mattered when it came to port authority affairs wildstein and baroni used the one constituent rule as barometer by which decisions would be made kelly and baroni face conspiracy and fraud charges in connection with bridgegate their attorneys have previously said they will both testify in their own defenses
bridgegate port authority officials planned to make fort lee traffic jam as bad as possible

the department of homeland security inspector general said that people who were ordered to be deported or removed instead eventually received citizenship ap photo mistakenly granted citizenship to hundreds of immigrants at least people who had previously been ordered to be deported or removed from the were instead granted citizenship the department of homeland security inspector general announced monday the mistaken citizenships were granted the department of homeland security explained in press release because neither its digital fingerprint repository nor the fbi fingerprint repository contain exhaustive records of individuals who have previously been deported story continued below the discovery was made by the department of homeland security office of inspector general which released report monday on the incomplete fingerprint records and the mistakenly granted citizenships the department of homeland security records are incomplete the release said because paper fingerprint cards used before were not consistently digitized the fbi records are incomplete because fingerprints collected during immigration enforcement activities were not always shared with the bureau the inspector general report specified that those granted citizenship were only potentially ineligible and were not necessarily granted citizenship incorrectly statement from the department of homeland security said that the department is taking steps to correct the issues that led to the incomplete fingerprint records and that not all applicants whose records were incomplete wound up being granted citizenship it is important to note that the fact that fingerprint records in these cases may have been incomplete at the time of the naturalization interview does not necessarily mean that the applicant was in fact granted naturalization or that the applicant obtained naturalization fraudulently preliminary results from the file reviews show that in significant number of these cases naturalization had been denied and that in some naturalization was not improperly granted department spokesman neema hakim said in the statement other cases are subject to ongoing criminal investigation or to proceedings that are pending or completed in at least three cases the inspector general office discovered previously deported individuals who were granted citizenship and then obtained clearance for security sensitive work at commercial airports or maritime facilities and vessels the release said all three have since had their security credentials revoked this situation created opportunities for individuals to gain the rights and privileges of citizenship through fraud inspector general john roth said to prevent fraud and ensure thorough review of naturalization applications citizenship and immigration services needs access to these fingerprint records republican presidential candidate donald trump has made the vetting of immigrants as they enter the major part of his presidential platform suggesting during the gop primary that america temporarily ban all muslims from entering the until more stringent vetting process could be put in place he has since backed away from that proposal which drew widespread criticism from both parties in favor of ban on immigration from any nation that has been compromised by terrorism authors
mistakenly granted citizenship to hundreds of immigrants
the pressure is on hillary clinton insiders in both parties agree clinton having lost most of her lead over the past few weeks and bringing more experience to the stage faces higher expectations than donald trump when the two square off for the first debate on long island story continued below that according to the politico caucus panel of activists strategists and operatives in key battleground states roughly equal percentages of democrats percent and republicans percent said clinton is under more pressure to perform than trump but democrats mostly lamented the low expectations for trump relative political neophyte who has exhibited little command of the issues she shouldn be under more pressure but so long as he avoids standing on stage and vomiting on himself the press will give trump glowing review said nevada democrat who like all respondents completed the survey anonymously hillary will need strong performance to demonstrate that she passes and trump fails the commander in chief test the media and trump himself have set the bar too low for trump new hampshire democrat added presidents don get graded on curve and candidates in debates shouldn be either one ohio democrat detected double standard for the first female major party nominee hillary clinton has spent public lifetime of being held to strikingly different standard and this debate will be no exception said the ohio democrat she will have to answer every single question flawlessly exude gravitas look presidential channel bill and barack oratorical mastery not raise her voice not cough wear an acceptable pantsuit smile enough be likable not laugh and have good hair day donald trump will just have to show up republicans also said clinton was under greater scrutiny on monday night but for different reasons tightening polls that show trump eclipsing clinton in some battleground states somehow she needs to reverse the trend said an ohio republican never seen anyone do it before this will be her chance and maybe her last chance she has to stop trump momentum with strong debate performance and she has to be able to stand on the stage for minutes and look healthy for minutes or the whole issue of her health comes back with vengeance added virginia republican all trump has to do is not say anything racist or sexist and look like he could be president among those insiders who said trump was under more pressure percent of democrats and percent of republicans most pointed to the gop nominee volatile personality hillary clinton is expected to do well she is policy wonk said michigan republican the pressure is on donald trump not to lose his cool he has been doing very well in his public appearances but that is with the assistance of teleprompter he will have no such help at the debate and if were coaching hillary clinton would be encouraging her to get him as riled up as possible to win the debate all trump really needs to do is meet expectations keep his cool and look presidential the question we are all waiting to have answered is can he be serious added michigan democrat can he answer questions directly how will he react or overreact when he is directly challenged can he control his temper two other takeaways from the pre debate survey most insiders expect clinton to win the debate majorities in both parties peg clinton as most likely to be the victor on monday night percent of democrats and percent of republicans media look at who best answered questions and that will likely be hillary said an iowa republican clinton mastery of issues and policies and no nonsense delivery will prevail over bluster name calling and promises that can never be kept added new hampshire democrat but not all democrats were so optimistic about clinton or the media through which voters will interpret the debate the press wants trump to win said florida democrat their disdain for her plus desire to keep the race alive means unless he really screws up they ll give him the win on the most absurd grade curve ever some republicans also claimed media bias in the other direction the media has never been more in the tank for candidate in modern history cnn nbc abc and politico will all say she won virginia republican said but then again everyone also knew that carter beat reagan in their debate as well insiders think the debate will matter asked whether they expect the debate to have significant impact on the race most insiders in both parties think it will generate momentum for one of the candidates among democratic insiders percent believe clinton will benefit from the debate percent think trump will get bounce and percent don expect the debate to move the needle trump will flounder ramble and lie because he always does michigan democrat predicted the moderators will challenge him and he ll get mad he ll complain afterwards that they picked on him and favored hillary first impressions are hard to shake off and this won go well for him the numbers were flipped for republicans with slightly less enthusiasm for the gop standard bearer percent think the debate will help trump percent think it will help clinton and percent said it wouldn have significant impact trump has the most to gain by appearing presidential and even tempered said new hampshire republican he does that successfully and he cuts into hillary greatest strength but some republicans said clinton could stunt trump momentum with strong performance monday night if she pins his ears back it helps her said an iowa republican if it draw it net negative for her she has to have something to stop his momentum she got to hit him with brick other insiders however doubted whether the debate would have significant permanent effect on the race we re past the era of the big debate swings the bloodless dukakis death penalty answer the reagan age quip the bentsen you re no john kennedy moments an iowa republican said swing voters are like the california condor critically endangered species disappearing at an alarming rate opinion media partisan polarization and two highly unpopular candidates make this battle over very small group of voters in about dozen states and whatever bounce comes out of this debate will dissipate as quickly as it appears added florida democrat does damn thing matter this year think not these are the members of the politico posted by frank wilkenmeyer on sep donald trump jr is quite possibly the dumbest person ever to take to social media in the very least it tossup between him and little brother eric who just yesterday made fool of himself with his childish self admiration for being the answer to crossword puzzle question along with free wifi pushup bras and bozo the clown together the dimwitted duo provide enough social media fodder to make fun of them well into the next generation with posts to spare when this election is finally over it will be almost sad to see them fade back into oblivion maybe we ll keep track of their twitter accounts just for giggle every now and then today silliness begins with oompa loompa jr pinning tweet that is certainly relevant to particularly volatile national discussion happening right now colin kaepernick and the national anthem as more and more athletes decide to take knee in protest to support black lives matter more and more conservatives trash them for it calling them unpatriotic and demanding they stop getting media coverage lord cheeto ii has been one of the most vocal accusing kaepernick of disrespecting our troops and those who died for his freedom for the left it simple matter of the st amendment regardless of how you feel about the issue these athletes have the right to express themselves yes that means from government oppression and prosecution and not public criticism but let not forget that it people like little comb over who are calling for police to stop providing protection for these athletes for their employers to terminate their contracts and some have even gone so far as to suggest they be jailed for treason for years we ve known that the only constitutional amendment conservatives care about is the second so when this tweet appeared pinned to mini douche twitter account this morning couldn help but bust out in hysterical laughter clearly when you re the son of pure evil you have hard time understanding the words republican nominee for president the man whose candidacy was considered vanity exercise year and half ago well no one is laughing anymore the latest round of polls shows that the support for the trump presidency is growing rapidly the latest fox news poll which was taken from september shows donald trump polling at one point lead over democratic nominee hillary clinton at the la times usc poll taken from september shows trump at with six point lead over clinton at the gap between the two candidates is also narrowing in the key battleground states the suffolk university poll which was taken from september shows trump at leading by points with clinton at the cnn orc poll which was taken september shows trump with point lead over clinton in florida clinton still has about point lead over trump in other key battleground states including pennsylvania and michigan but those gaps are getting narrower every day other states such as nevada and new hampshire which were initially perceived to be likely wins for clinton have moved to the toss up state category donald trump also continued his efforts to layout his policy framework with the introduction of another signature platform his childcare plan at speech in aston pa just outside of philadelphia spearheaded by his daughter ivanka trump trump childcare policy offers something for everyone across the economic spectrum the plan offers six weeks paid maternity leave to all mothers who do not receive this benefit through their employers this benefit will be funded by closing gaps in our existing unemployment insurance program lower income families will also benefit from the plan offering of childcare rebates through the earned income tax credit eitc program up to per year middle class families will benefit from being able to fully deduct all childcare expense on their tax returns families will also have the ability to establish dependent care savings accounts dcsas to put money aside tax free for childcare low income families will receive match of the first deposited per year generating up to an additional per eligible family per year dcsas can be applied to pay for childcare after school enrichment programs and school choice families can also use the funds in dcsa to care for an elderly parent expenses including in home nursing and long term care finally trump childcare plan provides tax deduction for stay at home parents effectively eliminating the tax punishment for parent decision to leave the workforce to be full time caregiver for child or an elderly parent donald trump followed his childcare policy speech with another economics speech to the economic club of new york which includes some of new york most powerful movers and shakers in the world of business and finance trump excellent week continued with his visit to the dr oz show where he released letter from his long term doctor revealing the results of his most recent medical visit and other relevant pieces of his medical history other than carrying an extra pounds trump appears to be in excellent health of course trump unveiling his medical records on television show comes on the heels of the recent concerns about hillary clinton health following her fainting at last week september memorial event and the subsequent revelation that she was suffering from pneumonia again only donald trump can turn the literal opening of an envelope into an event well it is an event alright particularly if that envelope is opened on the dr oz show program which is reportedly watched by four million viewers daily with large percentage of female viewers during the one hour program the discussion of trump health was followed by the appearance of ivanka trump who was able to deliver yet another pitch about the newly announced childcare proposal to the aforementioned audience of women so yes somehow all this concern about hillary clinton health and capacity to serve as president has created multiple free publicity events for donald trump trump followed up the dr oz interview with visit to the tonight show with jimmy fallon during the visit trump permitted the late night comedian to do something unpresidential that is to say he told fallon that he could mess up his hair while most pundits would speculate that the moment was completely pre planned the fact that trump said yes to the display speaks volumes he demonstrated that he has the ability to laugh at himself and that he is not afraid to have bad picture taken furthermore the tonight show is popular with democrats and millennials of all political persuasions once again trump had an opportunity to make connection with millions of people who more than likely were not on the trump train oh and one more thing by letting jimmy fallon touch his hair on national television trump has finally set to rest all rumors that his hair is not his however small it another check mark in the honesty and transparency box now if all of this was not enough medal of honor recipients trump used the event to not only promote his hotel project as being completed two years early and under budget metaphor for how he would manage the us economy he also seized great again trump said once again political correctness be damned donald trump has had another amazing week the views expressed in this opinion article are solely those of their author and are not hypocritical focus on ideas such as democratization inequality corruption and regime change he is now frequently quoted on russian television which hails him as famous american economist and adviser to donald trump on questions of foreign policy all of which reveals something deeply strange about trump when he shoots from the hip his remarks do more than just whip up twitter controversies they also occasionally and unintentionally mint new species of insiders people who seem to be in trump orbit but who may not have and may never have had any access to the gilded inner sanctum at all but didn know page but maybe it was because some of them worked in different spheres of the russian economy he did after all have such an impressive sum page biography on the website of his energy fund merrill lynch in london moscow and new york where he most recently served as chief operating officer of the energy and power group his bio reads he was involved in over billion of transactions in the energy and power sector he spent years in moscow where he was responsible for the opening of the merrill office and was an advisor on key transactions for gazprom rao ues and others those were some of the biggest energy deals of the and page tenure in merrill lynch moscow office from to would have put him in the right place at the right time he says he was part of the carving up of rao ues massive russian electric power holding company he told bloomberg that he advised gazprom when it bought stake in the sakhalin ii oil and gas project those were huge huge things if he were deeply involved he would definitely count as player and surely he left at least trace in the records of those deals so called ian craig the ceo of sakhalin energy from to who was doing the negotiations with gazprom and department worked alongside page who at the time worked in merrill lynch moscow office it was and merrill lynch was underwriting the sale of one part of rao ues and torchinsky was resentful of page and the other merrill lynchers torchinsky and the in house team did all the work and page and his team would swoop in to give the presentation they were the fancy western window dressing it really irritated our team torchinsky told me over skype we worked around the clock and then they would come in and say something and we have to correct them these guys didn know what they were talking about as for page he made no impression whatsoever whether he was there or not it made no difference torchinsky says when you re dealing with pro you see it page unfortunately did not leave that impression ok harsh but then talked to page former boss former russian central bank chairman sergei aleksashenko who ran the moscow office of merrill lynch for part of the time page worked there he wasn great and he wasn terrible aleksashenko says exasperated and confused by the interest of all these journalists pestering him for information about someone without any special talents or accomplishments someone who was gray spot what can you say about person who in no way is exceptional he asked me page was vice president at merrill lynch in moscow which sounds senior but is common title in the finance world big firm like merrill lynch might have thousands of vps in the moscow office there were five ranks and vp was right in the middle in effect it was just the oldest of the youngest three from the bottom says aleksashenko when it came to finance aleksashenko says page was not specialist in any branches of finance or in any instruments when it came to energy page and his team were according to torchinsky mildly speaking not competent in the field of energy and says aleksashenko judging by the drivel he spews on russia you can tell he doesn really understand the topic trump putative adviser on russia and energy and foreign policy in other words did not create the impression of someone who was intellectual or well educated or someone who was in any way interested or knowledgeable in foreign policy says aleksashenko for the past few years page has styled himself foreign policy expert he has written columns in global policy journal new peer reviewed journal run out of durham university they are confoundingly written and make logically curious leaps in recent months renewed calls for equal justice have brought social tension across the united states after the killing of michael brown and eric garner by police officers in missouri and new york respectively he wrote although commonly overlooked the impact of other fatal mistakes by government officials in the foreign policy arena might vastly outweigh these tragic deaths in potentially catastrophic proportions he is the kind of thinker who writes that kanye west new slaves and the artist creative work offers valuable ideas that could fundamentally improve the direction of foreign policy and world affairs but does it by opening with citation from the oxford english dictionary slave pronunciation sl roping in adam sandler william buckley and dick cheney his speech in moscow new economic school was similar construction of empty spaces held together with repetition tautologies and abuses of the word ironically for the last years ve been researching teaching and writing about fundamental trends in the world economy which have really continued to evolve in this period and in the years immediately preceding it he began the video of the speech also suggests that after three years living there and lifetime studying the place he couldn really speak russian he had to have his questions translated for him into english except to quote haltingly brokenly vladimir putin we never meddle in the internal political affairs of other countries unlike the usa which is troubling for two reasons that the adviser of presidential candidate of major party is criticizing america abroad by citing putin and that the comment implied that he seemed to not know anything about anything going on in say syria or ukraine page also managed to find his way into fellowship at the council on foreign relations where he cut strange figure like other westerners doing business in russia page took the view that putin was not the blood stained and corrupt tyrant some in the west imagine him to be defending him as strong leader who brought order and prosperity to russia but unlike other entrepreneurial defenders of putin people at the council recall that page was not particularly good at it he had guilty seeming style in making these arguments making it seem like he didn really want to engage one person from the council says his columns made the rounds and raised eyebrows that blog post about the slaves that just strange says the council member he nice guy but of the people that know that have russian foreign policy experience or access and contacts he wouldn be in the last decile but he be in the second to last decile says one american executive with experience in russia and its energy sector you have to dip really far and wide to find guy like carter page mean wow should ve just dropped the carter page story but in the months since trump named him an adviser the campaign russia connections have become bigger and bigger issue fancy bear who was probably russian hacker broke into the democratic national committee emails seemingly handed them over to julian assange who continues to leak the information in way that is clearly designed to help one campaign and hurt the other trump second campaign manager paul manafort flamed out in august because of his shady business dealings with the pro kremlin side of ukraine and trump himself continues to say absurd things about russia and putin like publicly inviting the russian government to continue hacking american servers washington was in full hunt for red october mode and it was all could do to stay on page trail which began to look more and more like an infinity sign was not the only one seemingly everyone talked to had also talked to the washington post and then there were these corporate investigators who drew dark and complex web of page connections then there was page praising putin found myself juggling two mutually contradictory page narratives was page like manafort followed by long train of sordid dealings with dark and powerful players with deep pockets and deep resentments toward the west this was the person described by the corporate investigators trying to whisper into my ear was page man wheeling and dealing in energy contracts with china and turkmenistan who was vehicle for the kremlin to influence the american election was he man who during three day trip to moscow met with two of russia most powerful men and was now being investigated for it but it was hard to see that man when actually talked to people who knew him page made his way into the financial sector as it ballooned in the early part of the past decade securing spot at merrill lynch london and moscow offices today he claims he was cozy with gazprom executives his former colleagues laugh at the suggestion no one let him into gazprom aleksashenko says he didn go shake gazprom chief alexey miller hand he made sure there were cars hotels and meetings for investors in london another of page colleagues from merrill lynch confirmed that page role was simply arranging meetings between gazprom and western investors something normally done by analysts the lowest rank on the totem pole people organize meetings with gazprom all the time the former colleague said he hosted these guys in new york city but they would have done this times year used to do this it doesn require all that much skill you just send out an email to people saying gazprom agreed to dinner at this place at do you want to come the main thing is just getting those two gazprom guys to agree but because they agreed doesn mean they re close to him but the meetings did provide him with something else gazprom didn need money at the time says the former colleague they were the most profitable company at the time their net profit was something like billion year their problem was not getting investors but figuring out how to spend money in non efficient way if you read between the lines he was probably aware of that he would have known how inefficient and wasteful the company is page became an investor in the company and has according to filings advised other companies he worked for to invest in them after merrill lynch page tried to set up his own fund to invest in energy projects and called it global energy capital but he tried to do this in and we know what happened to the markets in the fund is registered to his father address in poughkeepsie page listed himself as founder and managing partner even though the only other partner seemed to be sergei yatsenko who was once mid level executive at gazprom he also maintained website and handed out business cards that listed fancy madison avenue address that the one around the corner from trump tower which was actually the address of co working space that carter page says an american businessman who has spent nearly decade working in russia that what he been doing without any actual funding without any actual experience without any actual connections or core capabilities he been trying to throw together these deals he always been operating at level far beneath that at which business in russia is done admire that it takes lot of gumption in the interest of due diligence also tried to run down the rumors being handed me by the corporate investigators that russia alfa bank paid for the trip as favor to the kremlin that page met with sechin and ivanov in moscow that he is now being investigated by the fbi for those meetings because sechin and ivanov were both sanctioned for russia invasion of ukraine don know this person said pyotr aven one of the two founders of alfa bank which is considered the western russian bank aven and his partner mikhail fridman have transferred much of their assets out of russia and have been quite critical of putin as for who paid for page trip aven was no less irritated by the question give them money don know how they spend it who they invite when they invite them have no idea he said of the new economic school which hosted page and of which aven is the main benefactor exasperated by my questions he snapped don bring these russian style conspiracy theories to me you are engaged in onanism said leontiev the spokesman for rosneft and sechin when asked him if page had met with sechin it bullshit just bullshit you need to understand who sechin is to even ask this question it hard to have meeting with him at all it absurd as for the fbi investigation well it unclear state department official who works on russia sanctions but was not authorized to speak on the record told me that for one thing there is no prohibition meeting with designated sanctioned individual moreover sanctions violations are not criminal in nature and not enforced by the fbi ofac runs them he added the story doesn add up what does seem to have happened is that various intelligence agencies were looking into page time in moscow then briefed senate minority leader democrat harry reid who wrote letter to fbi director james comey asking him to investigate among other things whether trump advisor who has been highly critical of and european economic sanctions on russia and who has conflicts of interest due to investments in russian energy conglomerate gazprom met with high ranking sanctioned individuals while in moscow in july of well after trump became the presumptive republican nominee got my next surprise when called stephen miller trump senior adviser caught him just as the trump plane was about to take off and asked him the tired old question who is carter page who says miller and then went off the record to expound on his lack of involvement in the campaign he has no formal role in the campaign hope hicks texted responding to my question now my interest was piqued there were whispers all over washington that despite hicks denial page was not only still part of the trump campaign but its conduit for russian influence was he one way to answer the question was to figure out how he even got on that list to begin with one source suggested to me that richard burt former ambassador to germany start treaty negotiator and longtime lobbyist for alfa bank was the nexus it was burt who helped draft trump foreign policy speech in april and had been advising the trump campaign via senator jeff sessions on foreign policy but when met burt at his office at the mclarty associates lobbying shop he looked at me and said he had never even met him the only person talked to about carter page is this guy at the washington post burt told me and told him never met the guy let me put it this way if have met him ve forgotten he the former merrill lynch guy right someone else told me that the page connection was rick dearborn sessions chief of staff who hired page because dearborn knew nothing about foreign policy but needed to put together foreign policy staff for trump alexandria virginia policy shop and he happened to know page but dearborn wouldn return my calls and someone who once worked for that policy shop told me it was neither dearborn nor burt but campaign co chair sam clovis who recruited page if he was part of that original group of people can say with percent confidence it was sam clovis this person told me not answering your questions clovis told me he refused to tell me if he was the one who found page but jason miller the campaign other spokesperson says carter page isn someone ve interacted with which confirmed what policy staffer on the trump campaign told me carter is red herring not rasputin he never met trump never briefed him he has zero influence none was page the shadowy messenger between the kremlin and trump tower or was he the nebbishy not very successful man trying to profit from the arbitrage between what trump said he my adviser and what his associates said who maybe wasn doing this right and maybe everyone was lying to me but it was hard not to come to the conclusion that regardless of whatever game the russians were running page was firmly in the latter camp don know about his russia fund other than it never really materialized says the prominent player in the energy space whom page has pitched on various energy projects every conversation ve had with carter has not been terribly serious they ve all been pie in the sky ideas there are usually issues with traction and execution capabilities he went on couldn name project that could connect carter name to any project that actually happened don know how he earned living off this the energy player says but think he been trying to be an intermediary if you hang around russia long enough it sort of like pinball machine something will hit you strangely it was not russian pinball that hit him it was trump according to the trump policy adviser this winter clovis began to draw up list of people who could serve as policy advisers to the campaign and give it some intellectual and policy heft at time when established republican foreign policy specialists were tripping over each other to get away from trump lot of people came to sam clovis in february march and said want to be part of the team says the trump adviser and that how it happened he just guy on list trump looked at the list and said he an adviser and now he milking it for all it worth now someone whom no one in the field had ever heard of was suddenly very important person in washington or at least could plausibly market himself as one was not aware of him at all until he was named to the campaign and even after that had never heard of him one russia specialist in washington told me he saw page at washington roundtable in june for indian prime minister narendra modi and what he saw was strange kind of person one who was very differential to everyone there in way that someone who is junior would use it to network but who was dropping hints full of meaning to anyone who would listen and be impressed he was saying he was planning to go to moscow the russia specialist recalls he didn say what he was going to do there but he created the impression that there could be some meaning to the trip according to congressional leadership staffer familiar with the intelligence briefings on page trip to russia the meetings did happen and that been established as fact think the investigation is more what happened in them but it remained unclear the staffer told me unprompted what this even meant it not just did he met with them or not but now looking into the bigger question of what the hell is going on said the staffer is he acting as conduit in ways that are against america national security interests wittingly or un should add it what hard to parse about this is he doing this with nefarious intent or is this just about guys who are thrilled to be living in john le carr novel or are they being played by much smarter people in the kremlin this seems to be vintage carter page man whose story never quite adds up as much as he tries to make the numbers work but he also mastered the art of manipulating the distance between his story as it is and his story as he wants it to be playing on the uncertainty in between to make himself seem more successful more connected even more evil than he really is and to try to turn profit off of that if page using his status as trump advisor for personal gain that another matter time for page to join twitter michael mcfaul former ambassador to russia tweeted after news of the investigation broke the russians may be feeling out the trump campaign via page but page must be loving every minute of it after all meeting russia energy czar is an impossible dream for would be investor struggling to make it in the world of russian energy but the dream entered the realm of the possible when trump said three words in march carter page ph now carter page ph has found perfect candidate to latch on to like pilot fish feeding off the carnage wrought by the oblivious trump shark for months now the american press has been twisting itself in knots trying to explain men like page and manafort and through them to answer the questions of whether putin is trying to destroy america by their hands and is trump kremlin stooge or just useful idiot and is there even difference there doesn seem to be one in the world of trump which in some ways resembles putin the waters of truth are muddy and deeply suggestive and that is all that matters is putin actually meddling in our election and undermining the foundations of western democracy in massive way or doing just enough to make us think he is and thereby acquiring powers he holds only because we believe him to have them want to hope that this is connected with the growing influence and significance of russia putin says of the rumors of russian meddling in the american election as we in the media continue to squeegee them around rarely really getting closer to the truth and watching it disintegrate in our hands when we think we ve finally grasped it julia ioffe is contributing writer at politico magazine

shattered that vietor said he has brought back brand of politics that is you punch your opponent as hard as you can it doesn matter if it low blow it doesn matter if it not of substance that bad trump can do the job ronald reagan another entertainer who forayed into politics was mostly success but he been judged as performer up to this point and not subjected to the cold fluorescent scrutiny of managerial competence trump has repeatedly flubbed tests of his basic understanding of domestic and foreign affairs apparently he wasn aware russia had annexed crimea until george stephanopoulos informed him recently he obliterated jeb bush that humbled patsy of the gop establishment in the debates but bush if anyone had cared to listen punctured trump bully boy promise to impose tariffs on chinese products correctly pointing out that such move would certainly spark countermeasures by beijing that could lead to global depression trump wasn aware of that fact or just didn care the caring part is kind of important if history is any guide in april sat down with one of his longtime advisers roger stone who described what it was like to brief an executive whose prime attributes were supreme self confidence and supreme impatience all you can do is present information and let him either assimilate it or not said stone who has known the gop nominee for decades when you write something for him keep it short and staccato he not going to read page white paper on the economy zero chance of that it just too boring don blame him don like it either so keep it simple and direct because that the way he communicates stone argued that trump isn an ignoramus just cut to the chase decision maker who is lightning quick study but george bush advisers speaking to biographer peter baker said that bush unwillingness to ask probing informed questions led to some of his disastrous decisions in iraq and during the nadir of the global economic meltdown president obama added daily economic briefing to his daily national security rundown to keep tabs on the rapidly shifting metrics of crisis trump capacity to intuitively assimilate information might render such processes useless but there not single presidential historian drawing oxygen who believes lack of intellectual curiosity is an asset for the job many americans might not give damn that he knows what hud section program is and his failure to answer informational questions that clinton would parry with ease will endear him to his screw the media base but don people have the right to know what he actually knows trump has gleefully trashed the rules of presidential campaigns so why should moderator treat him with the deference of someone who abides by the norms by assuming he possesses the basic knowledge traditionally required of presidential candidate does trump understand and respect the basic principles and traditions of american constitutional government again this is not given hillary clinton despises the press and dodges them as if they were pack of feral rats but she has never suggested they be stopped from doing their jobs through the courts trump who banned news outlets including this one from his events for most of the campaign routinely threatens litigation against publications that publish unflattering articles and in february went so far as to say we re going to open up those libel laws so when the new york times writes hit piece which is total disgrace we can sue them and win money instead of having no chance of winning because they re totally protected that new one for presidential nominee as corey brettschneider wrote in politico magazine last month for more than years the supreme court has held that for public figure to prove libel against news outlet they must show that the outlet acted with actual malice that is with knowledge that it was false or with reckless disregard of whether it was false or not during private meeting with hill republicans earlier this year the populist real estate developer expressed his fondness for article of the constitution the framers stopped at seven he was just listing out numbers said congressman blake farenthold texas trump backer at the time think he was confusing articles and amendments ok let write that one off as gotcha you can understand constitutional principles without citing literal chapter and verse but consider his reaction to the paris bombings last november when trump told fox news he thought the government should shutter some mosques where some bad things are happening the comment was decried by constitutional scholars of all stripes as radical measure that would violate the free exercise clause of the first amendment pillar of protection for faiths of all kinds why won trump forthrightly answer the most basic questions about his businesses and debts hillary clinton has appropriately has come under intense scrutiny for her six figure speeches to big wall street firms like goldman sachs and has refused to release the transcripts of her prattles to the plutocrats and serious questions remain about the lack of boundaries between the clinton foundation the state department and big money foreign donors who blurred the line between influence peddling and altruism but the clintons have released all of their tax returns in part because for many years they were required to do so as government employees and trump is the first major presidential candidate in the modern era to thumb his nose at handing over single one why does it matter because guy whose purchase on the presidency is rooted in his private sector acumen needs to back up his claims with proof in the same way that clinton needs to be held accountable for her purported record of accomplishment in the white house senate and state department at issue is trump fundamental personal narrative and his claim that he very very rich he is but maybe not quite as much as he claims he says he good for billion forbes and other outlets say he worth less than half that much more serious is the issue of trump debts the clinton campaign citing press reports that he owes large sums to overseas creditors in china and elsewhere has attacked him for being in the pocket of foreign financial overlords if that lie there an easy way to prove it by releasing the returns this isn liberal media witch hunt many republicans including supporters like house speaker paul ryan say he needs to cough them up and fast what the deal with his charitable foundation then there the matter of trump sloppily run and less than on monday bumble bee foods and employees were charged by los angeles prosecutors with violating safety regulations in the death of worker who was cooked in an industrial oven with tons of tuna jos melena was performing maintenance in foot long oven at the company santa fe springs plant when coworkers loaded it with pounds of canned tuna and turned it on temperatures reached during two hour process to cook and sterilize the tuna the body of melena was found when the oven was opened the company its plant operations director angel rodriguez and former safety manager saul florez were each charged with three counts of violating occupational safety and health administration rules that caused death the charges specify that the company and the two men willfully violated rules that require implementing safety plan rules for workers entering confined spaces and procedure in place to keep machinery or equipment turned off if somebody is working in rodriguez of riverside and florez of whittier could face up to three years in prison and fines up to if convicted of all charges bumble bee foods faces maximum fine of million we remain devastated by the loss of her colleague jos melena in the tragic accident company said in statement we disagree with and are disappointed by the charges filed by the los angeles dist atty office according to the associated press florez refused to comment and messages seeking comment from rodriguez were not immediately returned

all of you feel that those who get up every day and work hard for some reason owe something to those who just lie around doing nothing that not right why should anybody who has the willpower to tackle problems and obstacles in order to provide good life for themselves and their family be obligated to set aside some of their hard earned money to help other people who don want to work hard and instead rely on policymakers to ensure they have welfare or in this case affordable health insurance ryan opined the answer is they shouldn this is land of opportunities but the thing is to be able to capitalize on those opportunities one has to be willing to work hard and that the only condition working hard if you work your butt off every single day you can afford whatever you want including the of the mv nisshin maru japan primary whaling vessel and the world only whaler factory ship was forced to leave the deck temporarily as gas leak was detected within the ship processing factory that resulted in the ship being temporarily disabled all while continuing to carry approximately tons of oil the resulting panic lead members of the ship to jump off the boat before proper emergency procedures were taken and lifeboats had been set to sea the swimming crew members were then ferociously attacked by school of killer whales that decimated large number of the crew within moments it was horrific claims asuka kumara mechanical engineer who witnessed the gruesome scene the water was red with blood there were bodies everywhere he recalls in tears within minutes of the incident crew members had disappeared into the ocean the incident occurred in the southern ocean whale sanctuary near the south eastern coast of south africa controversial area to be whaling as recent international court ruling has ordered the country to ends its whale hunt in the antarctic the east asian nation halted its annual antarctic whaling mission after the international court of justice icj ruled last march the hunt violated an international moratorium on commercial whaling it seems japan just doesn give damn about international law explains environmental activist and spokesman for greenpeace canada james ben shahali based in vancouver the waste of life is always shame but the whales are not to blame here they were only doing what they are born to do kill for food he adds some greenpeace several witnesses darren winters had consumed copious quantity of alcohol before making the decision to demonstrate the home made device darren recreational diver commented one of the injured man friends for some time he been tinkering with an old scuba tank that he bought cheaply from dive shop his plan was to use an air compressor to feed smoke into the tank and then use scuba regulator to inhale it mr winters invited number of his friends over to his residence an apartment in ybor telling them he finally perfected what he called his scuba bong clearly it wasn bong at all pointed out one of his friends when interviewed by local journalists but he was so enamoured with that name we thought best not to correct him when his friends assembled at mr winter residence they found him heavily intoxicated he had number of celebratory drinks before we arrived as he was so delighted to finally have his scuba bong up and running with his friends present mr winters proceeded to offer demonstration of the home made device in action this is the point that everything went horribly wrong according to the witnesses mr winters was attempting to reattach the air compressor when he stumbled knocking the scuba tank off workbench and onto the concrete floor the tank basically exploded after winters knocked it over commented one of the witnesses none of winter friends were injured but the blast from the ruptured tank sent shrapnel flying directly into his lower body winter friends quickly phoned for an ambulance and he was rushed to hospital where surgeons spent over eight hours treating his extensive wounds his condition has now been downgraded from critical to serious but medical staff announced they been unable to save his testicles which had been cleanly severed by shard of metal preliminary investigations have identified that the scuba tank used by winters may be banned from dive use throughout the us this tank was manufactured prior to and made of type aluminium alloy that is known to have high risk of fracturing commented the lead investigator on the case we regularly audit dive shops in tampa to ensure these tanks are not being sold however the ban only extends to using the tank when diving if winters purchased the tank for the purpose of inhaling cannabis the retailer has technically not breached the law this news will be little comfort to mr winters who will likely be unable to file for compensation against the business that sold him the defective tank the young man faces long recovery but his associates shared their optimism that he would pull through he one of the toughest guys know commented one of mr winter friends he ll take the fact he won be able to have kids pretty hard though correction an earlier version of this post we all get lazy from time to time and just want to quit everything crawl back to bed under layer of blankets and live there until we feel better we might feel bit guilty but relaxing day in bed sounds awesome even though it luxury which few of us can afford at least we can all fantasize about it if you re one of those who are in desperate need of some peace and relaxation nasa might offer you the perfect opportunity to do so and get payed on top of it but it may involve bit more relaxation than you re prepared for nasa has put out an ad looking for people who re willing to take part in their rest studies study which will require participant to spend straight days in bed relaxing and smoking different types of cannabis for which they will receive salary of usd during the relaxation period participants are allowed to read books play games skype and smoke weed they can do whatever they want as long as it involves staying in bed week after week earning cool usd per week so what is the exact purpose of these studies these studies have the purpose of figuring out the best way to preserve astronauts health and safety during periods of prolonged space travel complete rest and relaxation is the best way to stimulate zero gravity in space because zero gravity actually means zero weight or strain on your muscle additionally they wanted to see how marijuana will affect the body in such an environment the rest study is very convenient way to examine the changes our body endures during space travel this study is designed to achieve three core tasks examining how the astronauts changing physiology in space could affect the process of certain missions examining if the astronauts physiological state could affect their ability to perform in particular tasks preparing countermeasures to combat any impairment that these physiological conditions may impose the study participants were divided into two groups exercising and non exercising the exercising group will have to exercise on specially designed equipment to maintain the laying down position and smoke cannabis while the non exercising group will just have to lie down and relax completely the entire study will last somewhere between and depending on whether you re in the exercising or non exercising group once the study begins during the initial days non exercising subjects and days exercising subjects you can move around the bed rest area freely in and out of bed but once this period ends for the next days you ll be forbidden from leaving your bed for days you ll have to lie down with your feet up kick back and enjoy you ll get out of bed only for few tests and nothing more days of complete lazing during the study nasa will have to conduct bone muscle and heart tests as well as tests of your circulatory and nervous systems your nutritional condition and your body immunity system but is it worth it you may not think so at first but spending two whole months in bed can be really excruciating at some point you may feel like you can take it anymore but at least you can rest assured that your efforts will help in the advancement of human space travel this will probably be your only opportunity to say that you ve actually helped send the first astronauts to mars by just being your lazy self and doing nothing in particular but lying flat on your back

but this time nasa confirms what been circling the web recently our planet earth will experience total darkness for days in november starting from november to november nasa reports that this strange occurrence was expected to happen but they didn know exactly when upon more detailed examination the astronomers from nasa confirmed that the phenomenon will start on november at am and will most likely last until november pm images jpg according to experts this blackout will be caused by an astronomical event between jupiter and venus there was even detailed pages document written by charles bolden head of nasa explaining the strange event to officials at the white house according to the report during this specific period jupiter and venus will come in close proximity of each other and will be separated by just degree venus will move to the south west of jupiter and as result it will shine times brighter than jupiter venus bright light will heat up the gases in jupiter causing reaction which will release an absurdly high amount of hydrogen into the space this reaction will come in contact with our sun at am on november th once the hydrogen reaches the sun massive explosion is bound to occur on the surface of the sun increasing the temperature to more than degrees the whole process will generate so much heat that the sun will change its color into bluish shade once this happens the sun will need minimum of days to restore its normal color and temperature as result of this strange phenomenon the sun light will be seen much dimmer from the earth and hence the day blackout nasa is talking about we do not expect any major effects from the blackout event the only effect this event will have on earth is an increase of degrees in temperature the polar cap will be mostly affected by this no one should worry much this event would be similar to what alaskans experience in the winter bolden said
