shares share this story ninety six year old world war ii veteran and longtime new yorker contributor roger angell has voted in eighteen elections as he prepares to vote in his nineteenth he has published an op ed in which he shares his wisdom and experience and sends dire warning to the american people this man who has lived through the most dangerous threats to ever face our nation including the prospect of nuclear armageddon believes that the election of republican nominee donald trump would be catastrophe on the same level my country faces danger unmatched in our history since the cuban missile crisis in or perhaps since when the axis powers held most of continental europe and imperial japan controlled the pacific rim from the aleutians to the solomon islands with the outcome of that war still unknown angell acknowledges trump long history of outrageously offensive statements but chooses to focus on the one closest to his heart military service and the lessons of the second world war the most destructive conflict humanity has ever fought stick at different moment the lighthearted comment he made when in early august an admiring veteran presented him with replica of his purple heart and mr trump said always wanted to get the purple heart this was much easier mr trump is saying he wishes that he had joined the armed forces somehow he had chance but skimmed out like so many others of his time and then had died or been scarred or maimed in combat this is the dream of nine year old boy and it impugns the five hundred thousand young americans who have died in combat in my lifetime and the many hundreds of thousands more whose lives were altered or shattered by their wounds of war take this personally representing as do the last sliver of the sixteen million americans who served in the military in my war experienced the loss of more than twenty close friends classmates and companions of my youth who remain young and fresh in memory have named them in previous pieces along with some wounded survivors like my friend gardner an infantry captain who landed at normandy beach and fought at rtgen forest and aachen and the battle of the bulge was twice wounded my late brother in law neil who lay wounded on the field for two days during the battle of belfort gap and who hobbled with cane all his life and with two canes near the end every american of my generation can supply stories like these and once learned and tried to forget that worldwide seventy million people died in our war far too many people have forgotten the lessons of that dreadful conflict or never learned them at all as in trump case trump is selfish coward at his core draft dodger who then had the nerve to compare his promiscuity with the sacrifices of the hundreds of thousands of young americans who perished in the jungles of vietnam man who mocks war heroes and insults the families of our slain warriors man who uses our veterans for cheap propaganda stunts and tosses them aside once they ve served their purpose trump is uniquely ill suited for the presidency man enslaved by his ego and devoid of principle negatives that deeply disturb mr angell mr trump is endlessly on record as someone who will not back down who cannot appear to pause or lose he is man who must win stay on the attack and who thinks first and last how will look this is central and what comes after it for me at times is concern for what it must be like for anyone who facing an imperative as dark and unforgiving as this finds only the narcissist mirror for reassurance on the other hand mr angell has glowing praise for democratic nominee hillary clinton woman who has spent her entire life in public service who has shown time and time again that she has backbone of steel and is up to the pressures of the presidency will cast my own vote for hillary clinton with alacrity and confidence from the beginning her life has been devoted to public service and to improving the lives of children and the disadvantaged she is intelligent strong profoundly informed and extraordinarily experienced in the challenges and risks of our lurching restlessly altering world and wholly committed to the global commonality her well established connections to minorities may bring some better understanding of our urban and suburban police crisis ms clinton will make strong and resolute president at last female leader of our own and in the end perhaps unifying one he saves his best criticism for the end however as he nervously ponders what president trump might be responding to an ordinary day in the white house if donald trump wins this election his nights in the white house will very soon resemble those of president obama new day is arriving and with it the latest rush of bad news another police shooting out west another suicide bomber in yemen and other urgent briefings from world already caught up in the morning difficult events he needs to respond but the beginning of this president response is always reliably at hand how will look we absolutely cannot elect president that will put his own public image above the needs of the american people read louisiana deputy city marshal is in hot water after body cam footage revealed him shooting at suspect who had his hands up in the air this is sadly becoming too common story in the news as awareness of problems with officers who have hair trigger fingers grows what makes this story sadly and horrifically unique though is that deputy derrick stafford also shot and killed the suspect six year old son and stafford is claiming self defense for that because of course he is stafford out of fear for his life and that of his fellow officers began shooting at the vehicle to prevent any further actions by christopher few which would put the officers in imminent danger officers went after christopher few after watching an argument between him and his girlfriend outside bar just before the shooting they claimed witnessing domestic abuse as the reason they decided to chase down few whose six year old son jeremy was in the front passenger seat rounds were fired although few had his hands up but no firearm was found in the car and few and jeremy were both shot while still in the car stafford and his partner norris greenhouse said that after few drove forward and then backed up they were in fear for their lives so they fired that always the story though it makes us wonder just what police departments are teaching that so many officers shoot first and ask questions later claiming they were in fear for their lives when it obvious that their suspects were unarmed and even had their hands in the air reports claim that neither stafford nor greenhouse knew jeremy was in the car when they opened fire few was critically wounded and jeremy who was autistic non verbal and in special needs first grade class was murdered stafford plea of self defense is huge middle finger to few and the rest of jeremy grieving family arguments will be heard in court next week where judge william bennett will decide whether the indictments stand featured image via louisiana state police facebook page

donald trump is turning to snapchat to drum up support from young voters ahead of tonight presidential debate the republican candidate campaign launched nationwide filter on the popular social network monday while some candidates including hillary clinton have paid for local snapchat filters during regional events in the past this is the first sponsored political filter available nationwide snapchat users now have the option to take selfies and photos with picture frame design that says debate day donald trump vs crooked hillary before sharing with friends the filter also features fireworks on the sides and banner at the bottom with his campaign slogan make america great again related say hello to snap inc anyone can create filter on snapchat using the app geofilters feature but its availability is typically limited to proximity to an event location or community it unclear how much trump campaign paid for the filter to show up for users nationwide spokesperson for the trump campaign did not immediately respond to request for comment sponsored filters have long been way for snapchat now rebranded as snap inc to bring in ad dollars in addition to showing sponsored videos within the app related million ratings expectations for first trump clinton debate trump and clinton have used other social media networks including twitter twtr tech and facebook fb tech to target younger audiences but snapchat is notoriously popular with teens and millennials core group of voters both candidates hope to win over rather than actually try and persuade people the trump campaign is throwing money into fire pit the clinton campaign said in statement this features joke that given trump deep unpopularity with young voters will be used mainly at their own expense looks like berniesanders campaign bought sponsored snapchat geotag filter at hillaryclinton event pic twitter com yk zemluh noah gray noahgraycnn january recent polls suggest clinton has failed to gain the kind of enthusiasm that drove younger voters to the polls four and eight years ago between the two major party candidates clinton has used snapchat more so far earlier this year clinton camp launched filter which targeted those attending trump rally in california clinton also released one during the republican national convention which featured quote from trump about how clinton would make great president during the primaries presidential hopefuls like bernie sanders also used filter during clinton rally

shares share this story the first debate showdown of republican nominee donald trump and democratic nominee hillary clinton was expected to be brutal altercation between the two candidates instead the viewing audience was treated to one sided destruction with clinton appearing cool and presidential while trump gave the worst debate performance in presidential history each candidate had the ability to invite guests for moral support and clinton invited billionaire mark cuban who has been one of the loudest voices against trump in the media there is no love lost between the two businessmen and cuban even said of trump there was no bigger jagoff in the world the indebted businessman happily admitted on stage in front of cuban to being in debt at least million the shameless trump who became more unhinged as the night progressed freely gave away one of his biggest secrets that he does not and has not paid any federal taxes in years clinton speculated about this and like predictable rube under the hot lights trump cracked under the pressure rather than offer an explanation or deflection to clinton hypothesis trump agreed he paid no taxes and said that makes me smart trump cheap explanation sounded like something third grader on the playground would offer rather than presidential candidate an hour after the debate trump immediately began walking back his statement and denied he had ever said it this type of shamelessness is difficult to combat when asked it sounds like you admitted you haven paid federal taxes and that was smart is that what you meant to say trump replied no didn say that at all trump insulted every american who pays their fair share of taxes and cuban was not amused nor impressed after the debate cuban said get audited every year my taxes are it takes me minutes just to sign all the different taxes that have to spend and tell my tax lawyers and everybody you know take advantage of do what the law recommends but not against paying taxes and ll give you perfect example when the dallas mavericks were building new practice facility which was just opening had the opportunity to go to dallas and and play different cities against each other to get different rebates and everything didn do it couple years ago we had some issues in dallas just wrote check to the general treasury this year we had after the shootings in orlando had concerns about the lgbt community in dallas just wrote million dollar check to the city of dallas to support bunch of different programs the luckiest guy in the world there nobody who been as blessed as me and my family so far knock on wood is healthy and at some point you have to realize you have to give back and you have to realize that this is country that been great to us and you can just take take take take take take mcuban on trump saying not paying taxes makes him smart debatenight pic twitter com upnunatukv stefan becket becket september the contrast between cuban and trump could not be more stark cuban believes in paying his fair share to society to help those who are less fortunate than him while admitting he owes his success to society trump is content and even proud that he bleeds society for as much money as possible while offering to pay back nothing did trump say he was interested in paying higher taxes no did trump say he would like to reform the tax code so that he would be forced to pay higher taxes no trump has no interest in paying his taxes to help fund schools so that children will grow to be more intelligent because if they did they would certainly not support him trump has no interest in paying taxes to help pay for the roads which are used to deliver the cheaply made chinese goods to which his name is affixed in trump world there is two tiered system one for him and one for everyone else add your name to millions demanding that congress take action on the president crimes impeach donald trump

an ohio judge ordered an attorney jailed for five days after she refused to remove black lives matter pin she wore to court the lawyer is appealing the case attorney andrea burton of youngstown ohio was charged with contempt of court and given five day jail sentence on july after she refused to take off the pin at judge robert milich request the new york daily news reported the judge reportedly called burton who was representing client at the time into his chambers and spoke privately to her about the matter when the lawyer continued to wear the pin he adjourned the proceedings and ordered her to be held on contempt charge milich told wkbn he made his ruling based on supreme court precedent that allows judges to prohibit political expression in courtrooms popular video this young teenage singer was shocked when keith urban invited her on stage at his concert few moments later he made her wildest dreams come true there difference between flag pin from your church or the eagles and having pin that on political issue milich said the judge claimed his decision was not influenced by his own personal views judge doesn support either side he told wkbn judge is objective and tries to make sure everyone has an opportunity to have fair hearing and it was situation where it was just in violation of the law burton has been released pending an appeal on the condition that she refrain from wearing any items that make political statement in court if she loses the appeal she will have to serve five days in jail popular video this young teenage singer was shocked when keith urban invited her on stage at his concert few moments later he made her wildest dreams come true the attorney told new york daily news that her constitutional right to free speech superseded supreme court case law and the judge discretion it an act of civil disobedience understand that burton told ny daily news not anti police work with law enforcement and hold them in the highest regard and just to say for the record do believe all lives matter but at this point they don all matter equally and that the problem in the justice system mike brickner the senior policy director of the american civil liberties union of ohio said that judges are generally given wide latitude in what they allow or don allow in the courtroom although their decisions must be reasonable and fairly applied there have been cases in the past when people have been given contempt of court for refusing to comply with judge order to remove an article of clothing that may have message on it brickner wrote in july email to wkbn many times this has been done to retain the defendant right to fair trial
lawyer jailed for wearing black lives matter pin in court
former president bill clinton and his clinton health access initiative chai distributed watered down hiv aids drugs to patients in sub saharan africa and likely increased the risks of morbidity and mortality according to draft congressional report obtained by the daily caller news foundation the congressional report titled the clinton foundation and the india success story was initiated by rep marsha blackburn tennessee republican and vice chair of the house energy and commerce committee the chai program to help aids victims is considered one of the clinton foundation most important contributions and is probably its best known initiative the congressional report focused on clinton decade long relationship with controversial indian drug manufacturer called ranbaxy which chai used as one of its main distributors of hiv aids drugs to third world countries it also highlighted the work of dinesh thakur former ranbaxy employee who became star whistleblower and permitted the government to launch landmark lawsuit against the indian firm the company was vulnerable to prosecution because it also sold its generic drugs on the market ranbaxy ultimately pleaded guilty in to seven criminal counts with intent to defraud and the introduction of adulterated drugs into interstate commerce the department of justice further levied million fine and forfeiture on the company this is the largest false claims case ever prosecuted in the district of maryland and the nation largest financial penalty paid by generic pharmaceutical company said attorney for the district of maryland rod rosenstein when ranbaxy pleaded guilty when companies sell adulterated drugs they undermine the integrity of the fda approval process and may cause patients to take drugs that are substandard ineffective or unsafe said stuart delery acting assistant attorney general for the civil division of the department of justice when the government announced its action against the indian company the department of justice stated in its final settlement alleged due to the company diluted drugs it subjected patients to increased risks of morbidity and mortality according to the report the question becomes how many people lost their lives how many people found it was false promise asked blackburn in an interview with thedcnf the possibility that chai distributed adulterated and diluted aids drugs to third world victims could shake the foundations of the clinton charity and spark new round of scrutiny in the final weeks of presidential candidate hillary clinton campaign blackburn said she delivered the report to the inspector generals at the department of health and human services and to the department of state where hillary served as secretary of state during president barack obama first term the congressional study also highlighted the unseemly ties between bill and two controversial indian americans who have been investigated and sanctioned by the food and drug administration fda and the securities and exchange commission the most troubling revelations concern the clinton foundation vigorous promotion of ranbaxy despite mounting evidence the indian firm had persistently poor quality control and attempted to cover it up through either faulty or fraudulent reporting to the fda it is unclear at this juncture how many aids patients received the watered down drugs propublica estimated that in alone the agency for international development allocated million to ranbaxy and delivered more than million packages substandard hiv medicines cause health problems for patients perhaps even accelerating death from hiv related infections roger bate an economist at the american enterprise institute who researches substandard and counterfeit medicines told thedcnf thakur told thedcnf that many of the company anti retroviral drugs were used to stabilize platelet and white blood cell counts in aids patients these drugs allow it to stabilize and essentially provide immunity to patients if the content of the medicine is not what is listed on the label you will not see the platelet levels or the wbc levels stabilize he said ranbaxy first public hint of problems occurred in august one year after chai began working with the firm the world health organization reported irregularities involving three ranbaxy drugs in south africa according to the report the fda sent public warning letter to ranbaxy in about reported irregularities in the company quality control efforts it concluded that the drugs which included anti retroviral hiv aids medications show much lower potencies in these batches although ranbaxy generic drugs are now barred from being sold in the chai and the former president continue to praise ranbaxy and distribute the company hiv aid drugs to patients abroad bill heaped praise on ranbaxy in during speech in mumbai saying the drugs saved millions of lives neither chai nor the clinton foundation have announced they severed ties with ranbaxy thakur said he now public health activist who tries to get global health charities to focus on the quality of drugs rather than simply on access to patients the whistleblower tried to meet with chai and clinton foundation officials but was only met with silence have tried to reach out to them he told thedcnf but haven had great amount of success with the clinton foundation chai was part of the clinton foundation until when it spun off into separate entity the groups still have some overlapping board members and staff and they continue to operate in close coordination bill clinton for example is deeply involved with both organizations charles ortel wall street analyst who has been an outspoken critic of the legal missteps by the clinton foundation claims their separation was deeply suspect in the application trustees of the new entity including bill clinton falsely claim the entity is not successor to previous efforts this is not true they purposefully obscure the fact that similar operation called chai was by far the largest piece of the original foundation ortel told thedcnf the congressional study suggests bill may have relaxed quality standards in executive order he signed an executive order that relaxed intellectual property policy standards promising the government would not revoke or revise the intellectual property laws of any sub saharan country relating to hiv aids medicines or technologies the report states chai announced in october it was going to distribute generic low cost hiv drugs from four foreign drug manufacturers ranbaxy cipla of mumbai india matrix labs of hydrabad india aspen pharmacare of johannesburg south africa chai endorsement also allowed ranbaxy to manufacture hiv drugs that would be bought by the government under the president emergency plan for aids relief billion initiative proposed by former president george bush the flow of funds combined with clinton endorsement allowed the four foreign drug manufactures to become good acquisition targets according to the study ranbaxy filed abbreviated new drug applications three of which were approved by the fda according to the congressional study eventually the firm would produce generic hiv drugs the companies enjoyed great financial profits and they exploded as they partnered with the foundation for several years the report states the study also examined the key players in the clinton chai orbit the potential for corruption and how the program ultimately benefited the clinton foundation in terms of donor contributions one relationship unearthed by the report was the american indian foundation which clinton co founded with indian american businessmen rajat gupta and vinod gupta in rajat was convicted of insider trading in in sensational trial vinod eventually was forced to resign as ceo and chairman of the company infogroup and was fined million in securities and exchange commission investigation one of the charges stated vinod had awarded bill million without board approval blackburn says the worst part of the story were the false hopes offered by the clinton foundation you think about the emotional state of health care workers as they are dealing with these individuals and the emotional state of the patients to me it disturbing and very sad she said the views expressed in this opinion article are solely those of their author and are not necessarily either shared or endorsed by eaglerising com

there is moment at every donald trump rally when donald trump marvels at the crazy spectacle he created is there any place in america as fun as donald trump rally he asks with mischievous pursed lip grin the moment always comes after protester tries to interrupt him only to be drowned out by an arena full of rowdy white people screaming trump trump trump that the fun part the joint release of pent up fury by thousands of proudly politically incorrect americans when you experience it in person you can feel their catharsis as they vent at the whiners and moochers and mexicans and muslims taking over their country gleefully defying the scolds who call them racist and rude for respecting the police and saying merry christmas donald trump has singlehandedly untied our tongues chain saw artist named chris cox the founder of bikers trump told me at recent pensacola rally story continued below when trump fans are asked about his appeal the first thing they usually say is that he isn normal politician and his rambling fear mongering name calling public speeches no matter how hard his new handlers try to keep him on his new teleprompter do not feel like normal political events they feel like wrestlemania with different kind of hero and different kind of performance art they feel like revival meetings for the donald trump church of cultural resentment with ritual denunciations of crooked hillary clinton barack obama we call him president obama because we have to treat him with respect right and other enemies of the congregation at time when americans say they re tired of politics as usual trump offers politics as deeply often disturbingly always unusual his opponent does not clinton events feel exactly like normal political events she may be the world most famous and polarizing woman but she running an almost generic democratic campaign politics as very usual tonight hillary clinton will take on donald trump in perhaps the most anticipated presidential debate ever rhetorical clash of two candidates with diametrically opposed life histories policy agendas and bases of support but their contrasting records and ideas haven been the defining divides of this strange political year what is really about is conventional versus not and no matter what happens tonight when you spend time at their diametrically opposed events you re constantly reminded that what makes this year so abnormal is trump he is violating all the rules of the political game rules that promote pandering and artifice as well as rules that promote transparency and decency and when is over it not clear whether those rules will still apply whatever you think of clinton she tends to observe polite society political traditions which is why her events would feel familiar to anyone who attended modern campaign stop the backdrops are decorated with red white and blue bunting and talking point slogans like love trumps hate or stronger together the small venues are selected to target niche groups millennials last week at temple university in philadelphia the disabled few days later at family outreach center in orlando and the crowds are carefully curated to avoid protests or other surprises the speeches are standard campaign fare dotted with wonky statistics and real person anecdotes to buttress well researched policy proposals the candidate as she has for nearly four decades in public life sticks to her prepared text her audiences are supportive though not particularly emotive thought it was very substantial very specific glenn mccoy an adult educator at catholic church who wore hil yes pin to clinton speech about supporting disabled workers in orlando the purpose wasn to whip the crowd into frenzy we re not looking to choose president based on emotion clinton had better hope not there electricity at trump rallies that hers can match it no coincidence that cable news often ignores her speeches to carry the trump shows live his crowds wait with giddy anticipation for him to name and shame enemies like nascar fans waiting for wrecks and they explode when he calls out the dishonest media the job stealing chinese the pc sensitivity snobs who think you re prejudiced if you want to keep illegal immigrants and islamic terrorists out of the country it entertaining to watch him violate norms declaring clinton lacks the stamina to be president suggesting her security detail ought to disarm warning the election will probably be rigged he flings out absurd claims about the skewing of the unemployment rate the savagery of inner cities even the temperature at his rallies it degrees in here and that considered cool for an auditorium he casually drops one outlandish bombshell the federal reserve is corrupt the fbi is covering up for clinton nafta was the worst deal in the history of the world then moves onto another before the last fully explodes clinton doesn do that whatever one thinks about her email protocols or benghazi or her penchant for secrecy she campaigns like typical candidate she has the strengths and weaknesses of typical public servant and takes typical measures to try to frame them for the public her problem is that trump unique combination of insult comedy and monster truck rally despite the flagrant abuse of facts and unsettling whiff of menace is exposing the focus grouped stage managed paint by numbers nature of typical candidacies clinton isn getting lot of credit for following the rules of game that always seemed inauthentic nobody understands that better than the political savant named donald trump he tells lot of straight faced falsehoods about clinton campaign like his accusations that it policy free when he used to mock it for churning otut too many policy proposals and when trump himself recently laid off much of his policy shop but there something to his caricature of clinton events as the lackluster politics of yesteryear at rally in miami he did sly imitation of clinton speeches he claimed with faux specificity that they re only minutes when they re usually twice that long with bored expression that suggested she just phones them in bom bom bom see ya trump smirked see ya going home many americans really do seem sick of bom bom bom see ya politics but the live experience of trump say anything middle finger alternative can be bracing advertisement for the mundane traditions he shredding every day before attending recent trump rally in pensacola watched video of his last rally there during the republican primary in january at the time the news from the event had been his just saying speculation that questions about ted cruz citizenship might be disqualifying but starting with the star spangled banner performed by kids group that later sued trump for breach of contract the entire rally seemed like trip through the looking glass to an alternative political planet trump spent the first minutes of his hourlong soliloquy bashing the bad dishonest very bad people in the media for failing to show the public the size of his crowds theme he revisited three more times he criticized soldier for using the word sir to address the iranians who briefly captured him he advised americans to take their money out of the stock market which he described as big fat bubble and predicted collapse that would be beautiful to watch he gleefully pointed out black man in the stands didn put him there not paying him he read long poem about deadly snake that was supposed to show the danger of syrian refugees called himself more militaristic than anyone in this room complained that common core education bureaucrats make year actually the president salary and announced the american dream was dead oh he also unleashed diatribe about incompetent contractors and staff after his microphone crackled whoever the hell brought this mic system don pay the son of bitch he seethed don pay em don pay em you know believe in paying but when somebody does bad job like this stupid mic you shouldn pay the bastard terrible you gotta be tough with your people because they ll pay they don care so we re not going to pay guarantee not paying for this mic so was ready for more theater of the bizarre when trump returned eight months later to pensacola seat arena which was once again packed to capacity vendors sold trump that bitch shirts and trump confederate flags the pastor giving the invocation shouted tyranny has raised its ugly head our constitution is under attack the crowd started chanting lock her up before trump even appeared he then took the stage to tremendous roar and well to be honest he seemed lot less provocative than had expected he freeing up our speech said one trump supporter we can talk about the muslim invasion we can be against amnesty maybe we ll be able to say merry christmas again trump was now using teleprompter which he had derided as tool of inauthenticity in january and while he used it more as guideline than script it was still jarring to hear him regurgitate staff written clich and republican talking points about encrusted insiders and turning the page he said the kind of things regular politicians say the history books are closing on the failed politicians of yesterday and once again we ll have government of by and for the people he even recited the monotonous details of military investment plan conservative think tank had prepared for him name checking new naval vessels in town with naval base the crowd was noisier and angrier than normal political crowd during one trump riff about lifting minorities out of poverty supporter in red white and blue trucker hat screamed what about white people but the rally still felt at least quasi normal trump did repeat few of his radical proposals that remain astounding when you think about them like percent tax on imports and his mexico financed wall but really who still thinks about them afterwards though saw breaking story about an offhand comment trump had made warning that if iranian sailors ever made rude gestures at americans when he was president as they apparently had during minor incident few weeks earlier their ships would be blown out of the water trump had essentially threatened to launch world war and hadn noticed back at my hotel checked my notes and was reminded that he had also literally accused clinton of causing all the problems in the world including north korean nuclear tests that began under george bush he had mused that personally think she an unstable person and complained that she could walk into the arena and shoot someone right smack in the middle of the heart and she wouldn be prosecuted ok he had denied cozying up to russian dictator vladimir putin and then he had cozied up again he been nice to me and if he nice to me that fine if we got along with russia that wouldn be so bad would it and at time of low unemployment cheap gas and new data showing that wages grew and poverty shrunk in at the fastest rate in decades trump had flatly declared that the country is collapsing those all would have been jaw dropping statements during any other campaign from any other candidate but the year of trump has desensitized many of us to his rapid fire transgressions we re normalizing the unprecedented at rally few days later in asheville trump called the military incredibly weak defended male spectator who roughed up year old female protester and said the black community which endured slavery and jim crow was in the worst shape they ve ever been ever ever ever yet the main trump story from the associated press focused on how he had refrained from attacking clinton over her bout with pneumonia under the headline restraint on clinton health shows new campaign discipline predictably trump mocked clinton health problems later in the week suggesting she needed more sleep warning she didn have enough energy to handle the rigors of the white house falsely claiming he was holding four rallies day and then just as falsely claiming she couldn make it through one that sort of behavior just hasn been seen on the presidential campaign trail but it that defiant you can tell me what supposed to say spirit that trump loyalists love he not politician nobody controls him lot of us are tired of worrying about people feelings always watching our and so it cool to see him speak his mind said alan smith year old firefighter from nearby gulf breeze who recently retired on his municipal pension bill turpin retired army veteran from brayton iowa told me at trump rally outside des moines that while clinton is classic politician for whom lying is like breathing he doesn even believe the official story about her health because he fainted once and he didn stumble around like she did on the video trump is businessman with nothing to fear he ll call spade spade and if you don like it you can shove it again and again trump supporters told me they appreciated the way he was fighting the forces of political correctness standing up for their right to primal scream what they believe about immigrants and terrorists and black lives matter thugs he freeing up our speech said norris westfall an auto detailer who wore an infowars liberty or death shirt to recent trump rally in asheville we can talk about the muslim invasion we can be against amnesty without everyone saying we re offensive maybe we ll be able to say merry christmas again it fashionable to attribute the trump phenomenon to economic anxiety but the trump voters interviewed at four separate rallies almost never mentioned it unless complaints that the undocumented are getting jobs and welfare benefits counts as economic anxiety they seemed less anxious about the state of the obama economy than the rise of the multicultural obama coalition and they seemed less anxious than pissed off at president many of them still consider foreign usurper at thought leaders more worried about islamophobia than islamic terror at racial guilt trippers who demonize cops while ignoring black on black crime in asheville watched an air force veteran named gary latham explode at some anti trump protesters who were chanting that they didn want hate in their state lazy motherfuckers get fucking job he explained to me that america was under siege with thousands of syrian refugees embedded in western carolina and that he was proud to be one of the vigilant americans clinton considered deplorable the trump voters interviewed seemed less anxious about the obama economy than the rise of the multicultural obama coalition and they seemed less anxious than pissed off one of the speakers before trump took the stage in asheville was white haired lady who owns custom frame shop and serves in the state legislature she used the opportunity to proclaim we want our state rights back we re sick of the same old racism crap getting shoveled down our throats says kim buckner nursing assistant who wore don tread on me pin to the asheville rally trump is saying what we re all thinking screw you call us deplorable all you want our rights don end where your feelings begin trump echoes those anti anti racism tropes describing accusations of racism as the oldest play in the democratic playbook and he begun regaling his white audiences with increasingly lurid descriptions of inner city life arguing that it so hellish blacks might as well vote trump ll say it openly and some people don like it don really care what do you have to lose his long riffs about how he ll fix neighborhoods so awful that blacks can walk down the street without getting shot have been described as outreach to non racist whites but in person they feel much more like creepy concern trolling for the benefit of jeering trump fans who want to believe that blacks live like animals when trump claims that black youths don get an education and have an unemployment rate of percent the real rate is about one third of that he fueling the kind of ugly stereotypes found all over the white supremacy sites he retweets every now and then the trump supporters interviewed seemed much less interested in supporting inner city blacks than criticizing their lifestyles bemoaning their dependence on government and blaming their president polls show that most trump supporters still think obama was born in kenya and many spoke to believe he also muslim who supports isis one notable exception was richard cohen jewish contractor who attended the rally in asheville cohen told me trump is pandering to racism anti semitism and fear of hispanics among his supporters he said white friend with two adopted black sons left an earlier trump event after hearing spectators yell the word but cohen supports trump anyway because he likes the idea of shaking up the timid finger in the wind political establishment lot of us who like him don like the stuff he says about race cohen said obviously some do this really isn normal and while clinton is an unlikely poster child for normal first lady whose husband was impeached after cheating on her with an intern secretary of state who agreed to serve the younger man who foiled her own presidential dreams she presents herself on the trail as dedicated but ordinary public servant who happens to be the alternative to bigoted freak remember watching her execute similar strategy in when she ran for senate seat in new york even though she had never lived in the state or pursued public office even though her husband was still in the white house after his tabloid scandal had transfixed the nation she simply ignored the weirdness of it all running as standard issue democrat in democratic state diligently discussing dairy policy and upstate development as if nothing else mattered and against basically normal republican candidate it worked majority of new yorkers agreed with her agenda and sent her to the senate to pursue it in though clinton has struggled to make case for normal she tried to push standard issue democratic agenda but in the year of trump the race hasn been about standard anything nearly one of every five americans lives with disability and just about everyone else wishes them the best so clinton orlando speech about valuing their work made sense politically as well as morally as an expression of her commitment to helping the vulnerable and creating an inclusive economy to quote the clunky slogan behind her podium in the corridor that constitutes the swingiest region of the swingiest state clinton spoke to supporters much smaller crowd than trump regularly attracts but far more diverse about her goal of an america that recognizes the humanity and supports the potential of all its citizens she also laid out four part plan her policy team had devised to help more disabled americans flourish in the economy just two months before election day the speech was designed to illustrate clinton concern about worthy issue it did that more or less afterwards her supporters praised her seriousness of purpose her depth of knowledge her willingness to listen nobody mentioned eloquence or flair but her people understand that she never hosted reality show thought it was nice speech lewis smith retired mechanic in orlando told me afterwards not very exciting but believe she ll do what she says the speech started slowly as clinton spent nearly the first half on shoutouts to key supporters few made for tv soundbites about the riots in charlotte and an abridged version of her broader stump speech about an economy that works for everyone her speechwriters clearly cut and pasted in some of her standard lines about her middle class origins her support for family friendly policies like paid leave and plug for her new book of campaign proposals about everything from alzheimer disease to campus sexual assault to small business incubators the rest of the speech was dedicated to the proposition that clinton is committed to promoting the talents and dreams of disabled americans who have been undervalued by society for too long it was nice sentiment expressed through the kind of political saccharine that sends viewers scurrying for the remote control across the country people with disabilities are running businesses teaching students caring for our loved ones they re holding public office making breakthrough scientific discoveries reporting the news and creating art that inspires and challenges us maybe some disabled americans create uninspiring art but not in hillary clinton speeches in the united states of america the greatest country in the world we believe that everyone is created equal clinton said this kind of boilerplate scores lot higher in truth value than in news value clinton did talk about her own work with the disabled from her push for their right to attend school as young children defense fund lawyer to her appointment of the state department first ever advisor for disability rights she mentioned disabled people she known including the unbelievably good looking actor christopher reeve who told her that family values should mean that every family has value and her discussions with advocates who said they want paychecks rather than pity she then detailed her plan which while infinitely more substantive than anything trump has ever said about disabilities was mostly placeholders about partnering with schools and businesses plus an elimination of the sub minimum wage that is currently paid to some disabled workers the audience responded with warmth if not exuberance but must confess that after watching trump claim obamacare deductibles were so high you need to die really slow vicious death to exhaust them accuse the federal reserve and the justice department of corruption and tell his supporters he doesn feel bad if they re working harder than ever because he is too clinton scripted remarks seemed noticeably dull she gave laudable and sensible political speech on an overlooked topic but it felt like political speech combination of virtue signaling and interest group outreach cable covered trump rally instead and was rewarded when boxing promoter don king dropped an bomb in his introduction there was nothing controversial or unpredictable in clinton remarks they mostly proved that she and her team had done their homework and that unlike trump who talks mostly about himself she knows enough to portray herself as part of team she didn even mention trump reprehensible imitation of disabled reporter because she wanted more positive message that day she was careful to say nothing impolitic which is basically politics geannie bastian student with cerebral palsy said her political awakening came when trump made fun of that reporter believe me ve seen that gesture lot but before it was always from children she said trump is every playground bully every disabled kid ever knew in fairness to clinton there was portion of the audience that seemed genuinely touched the disabled and their families joe kilsheimer the mayor of central florida suburb has younger brother who was written off by doctors as hopeless case when he was baby but went on to become the first eagle scout with down syndrome and lead productive life what hillary said about an inclusive economy really hit home kilsheimer said know lot of people don trust her because they see her filtered through politics and media but she got heart geannie bastian university of central florida film student with cerebral palsy who gets around in wheelchair said she was moved by clinton message that people like her matter and deserve to fulfill their potential but she said her real political awakening came when trump made fun of that reporter whose hand looks quite similar to hers believe me ve seen that gesture lot but before it was always from children she said trump is every playground bully every disabled kid ever knew political scientists disagree about the importance of enthusiasm voters only get to vote once no matter how fired up they are but they re less likely to turn out to vote if they aren fired up in any case even at her own events it lot easier to find voters fired up to vote against the outrageousness of trump than it is to find avid clinton fans voters of color seem especially riled repeatedly heard from black democrats offended by trump crusade to deny that the first african american president was american and his stereotypes of their families as desperate charity cases with nothing to lose my daughter has doctorate her husband is an orthodontist we ve got plenty to lose said betty edwards retired educator in the orlando suburbs there never been candidate who thought so little of us many hispanics are similarly energized by trump calls for mass deportations and wall sensing not just honest disagreements over immigration policy but broader push to make them feel like strangers in their own country andy gutierrez singer and puerto rican voting activist who brought boricua vota sign to the orlando event says trump has been one man registration machine he thinks we re all mexicans and we re all bad gutierrez said people aren super excited about hillary but trust me they ll come out to stop trump clinton excitement problem is real problem at her university event in philadelphia millennials who had swooned over bernie sanders kept talking about her in the milquetoast terms they might use to describe reasonably reliable accountant she ok guess said thomas davidenko freshman at temple my main worry is trump fingers on the nuclear code but say she knows what she doing in orlando met more actual clinton fans especially older women who admired her as feminist trailblazer but even her staunch supporters said they re struggling to persuade friends lou smith union cell tower technician for at said many of his arab hating white colleagues at work think she typical lying politician so they re voting for trump and her bernie loving daughters think the same thing so they re staying home she been around so long and republicans have thrown so much mud on her he said she great on the issues but it hard to get people to focus on that clinton is policy wonk and one could imagine that more normal campaign against more normal republican would have been closer to her wheelhouse she could have focused on taxes and health insurance climate change and diplomacy she might have framed the election as the democratic bottom up approach that produced prosperity during her husband administration and recovery during obama with the trickle down philosophy that ended in economic collapse under bush when bill clinton was in the chair everybody was doing great and then everything fell apart before obama fixed it said jeneka lloyd who owns small painting business in orlando man hillary should talk about that but trump is not normal republican and hasn focused on his policies because they re so insubstantial and flexible because he trashed bush as well as obama because he has gift for changing the subject with colorful fox news interviews or incendiary tweets and because his business record charity scams and racial provocations provide such target rich environment beyond the issues it lot harder to persuade americans of the magical thinking behind trump plan to erase the national debt while expanding the military and slashing taxes than it is to attack him for denigrating gold star family looting his own charitable foundation refusing to release his tax returns and other unheard of behavior meanwhile the media have balanced the narrative with scandal coverage of her sketchy email situation and her own foundation her approval ratings have dropped lower than any modern major party presidential nominee with the lone exception of donald trump so clinton has ended up in the proverbial mud wrestling match with pig they ve both gotten dirty and neither she nor the public has liked it tonight on long island trump and clinton will meet in very conventional setting and as usual no one really has any idea how trump will try to handle it which is big part of what makes him so compelling on television his team is already warning moderator lester holt not to fact check the candidates which makes sense given trump distant relationship with facts there will be rules governing the debate but trump political brand is all about breaking the rules what is clear is that trump will portray himself as the candidate of change which is exactly what he is he essentially wants to roll back the obama era repealing the president health care reforms wall street reforms and climate rules as well as the obama approach to the economy and the war on terror but trump represents just as dramatic change from the way politics has been practiced in the tv era upending every assumption about what is gaffe what is disqualifying and what you just can say if you want to sit in the oval office and represent an entire nation if he uses tonight debate to brag about his genitalia or invite the russians to hack his opponent well it won be normal but it won be the first time either and yes even though she unlikely to put it this way clinton represents the status quo not just continuation of democratic policies but continuation of the conventional rules of politics she playing the same classical music that previous candidates always played and it wouldn feel so stilted if her opponent hadn started playing experimental honky tonk the question for is whether americans are so disgusted with politics as usual that they ll turn to the politics of trump that question will be decided not by the thousands of americans who flock to trump rallies or the hundreds who get invited to see clinton but by the millions who will tune in tonight even though they would never attend political event but the question beyond is what will happen to politics as usual americans never liked it and trump has helped expose how cautious contrived and anodyne it can be but he has also helped remind those of us who have complained about it for living that if caution restraint premeditated choreography and other hallmarks of traditional campaigning aren the most authentic elements of successful political leadership they re part of it and while politics as usual does have some bogus kabuki theater qualities it also reflects some baseline values showing basic respect to political opponents and people who aren like you staying at least close to the boundaries of plausible facts recognizing that the things leaders say and do and tweet can have serious consequences that have constrained politicians in good way it not clear whether it will be possible to put the norms trump has shattered back together and while we may not have liked them we might miss them when they re gone not many of us would be better at our jobs if we felt unrestrained from saying whatever popped into our head whenever we wanted and trump just may have untied the tongues of the politicians of the future michael grunwald is senior staff writer for politico magazine

kallstadt germany few places in germany are as representative of the country heartland as kallstadt the village in which republican presidential candidate donald trump grandfather was born and from which he was later deported the hamlet of people lies nestled among vineyard covered hills about an hour and half drive southwest of frankfurt it has one bakery and one butcher every year kallstadt holds the saumagenkerwe in celebration of the eponymous local delicacy pig stomach filled with pork herbs bratwurst and diced potatoes trump may have captured large swath of the american electorate with his signature blend of populism nativism and brazenness and yet in the hometown of his forefather he remains distinctly unpopular in fact few politicians are less popular in germany than trump study by the pew research center found out that only percent of the country finds him trustworthy since local newspaper discovered that johannes steiniger member of the german parliament was distantly related to trump the year old has done all he can to distance himself from the presidential candidate with his statements about gay people and foreigners or with the language he uses and with his derogative statements about hillary clinton trump seems to do everything he can so that we get negative image of him steiniger tells politico trump rhetoric regarding immigrants and racial minorities is especially unpopular in kallstadt he stands for everything that bad says sarah hler yelling to be heard over the person brass band celebrating the saumagenkerwe in the town main square hler is former local wine princess the victor of beauty pageant to promote the local wine industry this year new dish appeared in the town annual festival saumagen ner fusion of the local specialty with turkish kebab everyone is welcome to join us here no matter what color they are says hler pink purple doesn matter tanja huber the year old incumbent regional wine princess nods her head in agreement since the prospect of trump presidency first became evident late last year reporters have descended on kallstadt seeking bit of local color quote or two and perhaps some hometown pride they don get that we really don give damn about trump says huber he never been here and he apparently doesn care about us either donald grandfather friedrich trump was born in kallstadt into vintner family on march previous generations of the trump family used variant spellings of the name including trump dromb and trumpff according to local historians or even drumpf according to family history by gwenda blair but by the time friedrich was born they had settled on trump germany did not yet exist as nation kallstadt was part of the province of palatinate in the bavarian kingdom the region was going though rough times unemployment was high those who had the courage left friedrich father died when he was eight years old and his mother struggled to make ends meet at years old friedrich decided to follow his sister katharina who had emigrated to the united states two years earlier he arrived in new york on board the eider on october he entered the through official channels but he had left bavaria illegally both he and his mother must have known that he would not have been granted official permission to leave the country unless he had paid bail guaranteeing that he would later return to do his mandatory military service said roland paul the recently retired director of the institute for palatinate regional history and folklife studies in the city of kaiserslautern according to documents uncovered by paul friedrich was stripped of his bavarian citizenship as his own request four years after arriving in the but friedrich was not done with palatinate seven years after his citizenship was withdrawn he visited the land of his birth to attend the wedding of his sister according to the family history by blair five years after that he returned once more to kallstadt where he met year old elisabeth christ they were engaged and friedrich came back third time to marry her in august but while the couple moved back to new york soon after the marriage and had daughter friedrich had promised his wife that he would sell his property in the and return to the land of their birth my grandmother said will marry you but will not go back to america with you donald trump american born cousin john walter told german filmmaker simone wendel in friedrich seemed intent on keeping his promise in he applied for permission to travel to kallstadt and although he claimed in his application that he intended to return to the united states within year with the purpose of residing and performing the duties of citizenship therein he took all his savings from the with him according to blair family history back in kallstadt friedrich attempted to get his citizenship back but though he secured the support of local authorities the district government put halt to his plans on february deportation notice was sent to the town office of kallstadt declaring that friedrich was to be told he has to leave bavarian state territory by may of this year at the latest friedrich was able to obtain three month grace period because his daughter had fallen ill but eventually he and his wife pregnant once more had no choice but to board the ship pennsylvania on july and return to new york shortly after that donald father fred trump junior was born the authorities said you are not german citizen you gave up your citizenship you have to leave says walter so they left and they went back to america and that why donald and are here friedrich now named frederick died in may of the spanish flu his widow survived her first husband by years and visited kallstadt many times during her life in february simone wendel the german filmmaker from kallstadt was given an audience with donald trump roughly two years earlier she had begun work on kings of kallstadt documentary about the two most famous sons of her tiny hometown donald trump and henry john heinz the inventor of heinz ketchup for months wendel had tried to arrange meeting with trump but his office had not replied to her letters she was only able to secure visit with the help of walter trump cousin who had visited kallstadt and seemed happy with the attention she was paying to the family history on the day of her visit wendel stood nervously next to walter in conference room on one of trump tower top floors she had brought linzer torte and two bottles of wine with screw on tops her plan was to sit down with walter and trump for coffee and cake the traditional afternoon snack in her home region but when she asked trump staff to make some coffee the only reaction she got was irritated faces his assistant just couldn be bothered she says hello john trump said when he entered the room shaking his cousin hand and looking confused at wendel in her loose turtle neck and the lonely cake on the huge table in front of her trump sat down in front of one meter long model of his boeing airliner and panoramic window overlooking new york central park wendel trying to remedy the situation pushed the cake in his direction and asked him to smell it afterwards just kept on thinking what on earth did do she says the cake looks really good trump said and he and wendel ended up talking for almost an hour until trump still claimed his family was swedish version of his family history first introduced by his father in reaction to the anti german sentiment in the during the two world wars but by the time wendel visited he had become proud of his german roots they grow them well in kallstadt he told her during their meeting they grow them very well believe me it good stock wow it beautiful trump said when she handed him picture of the house where his grandfather was born an inconspicuous one story building with gable roof that fantastic see how well maintained it is everything is perfectly maintained it great when their interview was over walter took wendel on tour of trump tower on one of the floors they ran into trump son eric trump have you ever heard the word kallstadt wendel asked him kallstadt trump junior replied no what is it

year old on sunday september carr rep stated that she died from complications from dementia apparently she was battling rare form of the disease carr story was very unique one which makes her acting journey so special at the time that she auditioned for the sound of music she was student at the san fernando valley state college she was studying speech therapy and philosophy and was also working for doctor was going to college and getting extra spending money by modeling in fashion shows in one of the stores one of the girls who modeled with me knew that robert wise producer director of the breaking hollywood legend just died of terrible disease
as my th wedding anniversary approached tried to be creative in buying gifts for my wife had the idea of silver coin that marked years of something or other went to local coin shop and as idled over some of the display cases noticed set of coins from the mid th century oddly the coins from the and were large up until when the coins started becoming at best half the size of the others oh the panic of the owner said when asked him about the change of size it was really bad the president didn seem to have any solution except to use less gold or silver in the coins story continued below now that is inept presidential decision making during the current election campaign there has been lot of gnashing of teeth over the possibility that whoever the winner is he or she will be so terrible as leader they will bring down the republic as the worst president since independence and before the current candidates were known the two most recent white house occupants barack obama and george bush have been consistently reviled by their detractors as the worst men to lead the country but obama and bush can both take heart and donald trump and hillary clinton can gain solace perhaps from knowing that no matter how badly they do they almost certainly won rank last by my reckoning that place belongs to james buchanan genial man though he was ve made quite study of him my innocent encounter at the coin shop only reinforced my lifelong determination to take an offbeat look at let say the lesser presidents my father was definitely the only one in our suburban neighborhood with biography of franklin pierce everywhere we went he forced me to read historical plaques stopping the car in shrieking halt at times to view them if were to write book about president it surely wouldn be about washington or lincoln or even silent cal coolidge it would have to be about someone as ineffectual as possible buchanan the only president from my native state pennsylvania turned out to be my man start with his anemic minimalist solution to one of america great financial downturns for long time before buchanan in effect precipitated the panic of things were going well for the country at least in an economic sense there had been bad downturn years before with multiple causes like war in europe the dissolution of the bank of the united states and overspeculation in oddly enough slaves and western land the great acquisition of land under president james knox polk from oregon to california to texas reinvigorated the economy and boom lasted for the next two decades railroads were the big player since so many people wanted to move west into the new territories and states manufacturing boomed domestically and then with foreign trade as well since europe had quelled many of its hostilities and american items were cheaper than those on the continent then the day before buchanan took office congress passed what he wanted the tariff bill of which lowered tariffs on panoply of items from abroad buchanan wanted to stimulate foreign trade but made american manufactured goods of the same sort less competitive three days later came the real fatal blow though the dred scott supreme court decision which fell on the shoulders of buchanan the case had wound through state and federal courts for at least decade but roger taney the supreme court chief justice and fellow alumnus with buchanan of small dickinson college wanted it settled scott was slave to military man who at times was stationed not in his native missouri slave state but in the northwest territories which were nonslave after his master died scott brought the case that he should be free because he had lived in nonslave territory buchanan wanted to be hero and thought if the case could be decided broadly it could settle the question of slavery in the union for good buchanan knew too though that the court had five southerners and four northerners and if the decision were split that way it would be ineffective he and taney had apparently agreed to have narrower decision or remand the case back to the appeals court if it were merely sectional since they felt the need to have some sort of bipartisanship for the decision to be legitimate ignoring the idea of separation of powers though buchanan browbeat robert cooper grier another dickinson alumnus and justice from pennsylvania to go along with the majority opinion which taney would write eventually new york native justice samuel nelson wrote concurring opinion making the vote even less sectional legend has it that taney on the capitol stairs just before he gave buchanan the oath of office at the inauguration told buchanan that the decision would become public in the next few days buchanan apparently changed his speech to indicate that and that he would be all for whatever the court decided two days later the decision came down taney castigated scott whom he said was not citizen being slave and thus could not bring any suit he also wrote that the constitution gave no state or territory the power to institute or conversely prohibit slavery thus all the compromises about it going back to the were invalid and in fact the fugitive slave law requiring anyone who knew about it to return slaves to their owners anywhere in the country was in force historically experts rate dred scott as the worst decision in the court history but short of that it was at the very least for the country with not just taney but surely buchanan responsible for it as appalled as most of the country was about the morals of the decision at the time there was practical downside too now no one knew whether he or she wanted to go west to use the railroads or to start business that railroads might profit from railroad stocks started to decline in value and then contagion hit and it was free fall by midsummer no one could take ride on the reading as uncle pennybags does in the monopoly game since the reading railroad had shut down as did lines now and then famous like the illinois central several lines like the delaware lackawanna and western and the fond du lac railroad in wisconsin declared bankruptcy thousands were thrown out of work and banks started foreclosing on loans and property senator william seward the leader of the new republican party come home from vacation to find out he had lost most everything he owned his stock in the illinois central promoted to him by his rival democrat stephen douglas was virtually worthless every bank in new york city effectively closed none would convert coins or gold into bank notes the oldest grain company in new york wolfe and co failed in august as did the most prominent insurance business in the country the ohio life insurance and trust co buchanan and his administration did nothing to stem the public hysteria calm words might have quelled it but his inaction only made for further runs on banks and thus more turmoil in markets the residue that mattered most though was the reaction caused by dred scott instead of promoting unity and opening up the west to more settlement as buchanan had thought dred scott thwarted it and brought an end to years of northern prosperity yet the south did not succumb as badly its agrarian culture was self sustaining and its cotton still had market in europe there was surge in arms sales there as well the economic downturn in the north exacerbating regional tensions the relative good times in the south caused northerners of all parties to further blame buchanan for being southern lackey buchanan response was underwhelming almost disdainful he said the federal government could do nothing in his annual message in december he said he sympathized with the travails caused by the panic but he would do nothing for individual suffering the government would continue to pay its obligations and would keep going on whatever public works projects it had started but would begin no new ones he said too many people had speculated in land and slaves and the like and deserved the gambler fate eventually he noted the youth and energy of the rugged american individuals would triumph though there would clearly be an interim of rough times in sense he was right because it took the rugged young americans who went to war in to bring the economy back throughout his term when fork appeared in the road buchanan managed to take the wrong turn when hostilities flared in kansas over whether that territory would enter as slave or free state buchanan wavered over which of two proposed constitutions would be valid exacerbating the killings some done by the wild eyed anti slavery radical john brown when later brown seized arms with small cadre of followers in harpers ferry west virginia just miles from washington along the potomac buchanan again diddled before consulting robert lee who had fortuitously been home in arlington on leave from his post in texas lee quickly went to harpers ferry to capture brown and quell the raid in other ventures though buchanan dashed troops out on strange and unproductive missions he caused chaos in utah quelling what he thought to be mormon revolt causing villages to be burned to the ground and dozens of lives lost over what was merely jurisdictional dispute he supported mercenary william walker forays to conquer nicaragua and guatemala and sent troops to try to annex parts of paraguay primarily to acquiesce to his southern base that wanted more slave states to come into the union then there was the little known pig war started when settler along the canadian border on the san juan straits in the northwest shot pig owned by the hudson bay co that wandered onto his property standoff ensued until buchanan sent troops otherwise guarding kansas where there was real problem out to calm the nonfatal except to one pig battle this was at time when there were about only soldiers in the army stretched as thin as could be as the election of came close buchanan refused to support the one democrat who could win stephen douglas because he just plain didn like him that caused the party to split into three factions each nominating candidate virtually ensuring republican abraham lincoln the election the southern states which had threatened secession started doing so during the interim between lincoln election and his inauguration in march thus under buchanan watch buchanan took the unusual position that the constitution did not allow secession but the president could not do anything to prevent it as the first half dozen states seceded buchanan lost several cabinet members he had lot of southern allies and refused entreaties by many including former president john tyler who would himself become confederate congressman to find compromises to bring the wastrel states back into the fold meanwhile buchanan allowed the seizure of armaments and forts by the seceding states and suggested the abandonment of the one major fortified island in the south fort sumter enter lincoln who has long been rated in serious surveys and schoolmarms speeches as the greatest of presidents lincoln no doubt was man with plans and savvy but contend that the bar was set so low by his predecessor that maybe if there were no james buchanan the worst president ever there would have been few notches more on the presidential rating scale for abe lincoln to climb today george bush is often rated one of the worst presidents in history thanks to his authorship of the iraq war and his presiding over the crash of and the beginning of the great recession obama is sometimes seen in the same light especially by the far right but as happened with honest abe and his predecessor perhaps that low bar will only make it easier for president hillary clinton or president donald trump to shine robert strauss is author of the forthcoming worst president ever james buchanan the potus rating game and the legacy of the least of the lesser presidents

story highlights trump was sitting in chair onstage just few feet away from king when he uttered the word trump has pledged to help bring jobs and safety to impoverished minority communities cleveland heights ohio cnn the controversial boxing promoter don king used the word while introducing donald trump during an event wednesday at church king who is black said the word as he argued that african americans cannot achieve success by emulating white people as they will remain negroes if you re poor you are poor negro would use the word but if you re rich you are rich negro if you are intelligent intellectual you are intellectual negro if you are dancing and sliding and gliding mean negro you are dancing and sliding and gliding negro king said laughing along with the crowd after the slip up you re going to be negro til you die trump who was already smirking as he listened to king didn change the expression on his face but turned slightly uncomfortably to his special counsel michael cohen and the church pastor darrell scott who head up trump diversity coalition trump who said he personally invited king to introduce him was sitting in chair onstage just few feet away from king when he uttered the word read more

donald trump jr son of the republican presidential nominee took to twitter on monday to publish graphic that likened syrian refugees to skittles the graphic asked the question if had bowl of skittles and told you just three would kill you would you take handful this image says it all let end the politically correct agenda that doesn put america first trump pic twitter com fhwog ssn donald trump jr donaldjtrumpjr september that our syrian refugee problem it reads trump added this image says it all the tweet drew both sharp criticism and support in the form of responses retweets and online comments the uproar led mars inc the parent company of the manufacturer of skittles to issue statement mars tweeted skittles are candy refugees are people pic twitter com vuwykzqujc mars incorporated marsglobal september hillary clinton traveling spokesman nick merrill retweeted trump saying this is disgusting this is disgusting nick merrill nickmerrill september the white house announced last week that it wants to increase to the number of refugees the accepts in the next fiscal year this year the country has taken in more than syrian refugees more than million people over half of syria population have fled their homes according to the latest figures with million displaced in syria and million seeking refuge abroad donald trump sr has proposed what he called extreme vetting of immigrants entering the country suggesting ideological tests and screening based on religious background
